0.title: Ben Stokes smashes 8 sixes in 10 balls in county match
0.article_body: Durham all-rounder Ben Stokes smashed eight sixes in 10 balls on Day 2 of his team's County Championship Division Two 2022 match against Worcestershire. The eight sixes included his five maximums in a row in an over bowled by spinner Josh Baker. Stokes reached his hundred off 64 deliveries. He scored 147*(82) before lunch was called on Day 2.

1.title: Work underway to prevent waterlogging at Delhi's Pul Prahladpur underpass
1.article_body: The Public Works Department (PWD) in Delhi is constructing an underground reservoir, with a capacity of 7.5 lakh litres, at the Pul Prahladpur underpass to prevent waterlogging during monsoon. The department is also constructing a permanent pump house of 600 horsepower to remove the accumulated water during the season. Last year, a man had drowned at the underpass during monsoon.

2.title: Man opens plane's emergency door & walks onto its wing in US, arrested
2.article_body: A 57-year-old man was arrested in the US after he opened the emergency exit door of the United Airlines flight he was travelling in and walked out onto its wing. The incident took place on Thursday when the plane was taxiing at Chicago's O'Hare International Airport. After walking out, the man slid down the plane's wing and onto the airfield.

3.title: It is atrocious: Camila Cabello on scrapping abortion in US
3.article_body: Singer Camila Cabello has said that the US Supreme Court overturning basic abortion rights is atrocious, adding that it's going to affect poor women the most. "The idea of having one moment transform the course of a woman's life is tragic. And it's tragic the people affected are not having a say," the singer added.

4.title: 30 Gurugram liquor shops without fire safety nod to be issued notices
4.article_body: Gurugram fire department will issue notices to about 30 liquor shops' owners and their warehouses across the city, which don't have a valid fire NOC, officials said. These shops will reportedly have to procure a NOC from the department, otherwise, legal action will be initiated against them. This comes days after a massive fire gutted a liquor shop in Gurugram.

5.title: Over 30 students punch, kick each other after father confronts son's bullies in US
5.article_body: A fight broke out between more than 30 students at a school in US' Arizona allegedly after a student's father, Willie Smith, confronted his son's bullies. A video of the incident has gone viral on social media, showing Smith and students kicking and punching each other as security officers try to stop them. At least two people have been arrested.

6.title: One of oldest-surviving Hizbul terrorists, 2 others killed in encounter in J&K
6.article_body: Security forces on Friday gunned down Ashraf Molvi, one of the oldest-surviving terrorists of Hizbul Mujahideen, along with two other militants in an encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag, police said. The encounter took place near the route of the annual Amarnath Yatra. Ashraf was included in the list of wanted terrorists and had been active in Kashmir since 2013.

7.title: 28 kg marijuana & 225 gm brown sugar seized in Hyd, 4 arrested
7.article_body: Hyderabad Police said that they seized 28 kg of marijuana and 225 gms of brown sugar from an interstate drug ring. Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand conducted a press meet where he said that four drug peddlers were arrested in the case. This comes a day after the Cyberabad Police recovered over 104 kgs of marijuana.

8.title: Which are the top 5 fastest deliveries in IPL history?
8.article_body: Shaun Tait had bowled the fastest delivery in IPL while representing RR against DC in an IPL 2011 match. He had clocked 157.3kmph, as per ESPNcricinfo. SRH's Umran Malik on Thursday bowled the second-fastest (157kmph) and the fourth-fastest (155.6kmph) deliveries in IPL. DC's Anrich Nortje has bowled the third-fastest (156.2kmph) and fifth-fastest (155.2kmph) deliveries in IPL.

9.title: Man acquitted of murder after 13 yrs in jail in MP, state told to pay him ₹42 lakh
9.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh High Court has set aside the conviction of an ex-MBBS student who was jailed in 2008 after being accused of killing his girlfriend. Criticising the police for "falsely implicating" the man, the High Court also directed the state government to pay ₹42 lakh to him. "The case reveals a sordid saga of manipulative, preconceived investigation," it said.

10.title: L&T lnfotech CEO quits citing personal reasons as Mindtree merger announced
10.article_body: Larsen & Toubro lnfotech on Friday said that its CEO and Managing Director Sanjay Jalona has resigned from his position due to personal reasons. The development comes after L&T lnfotech announced its board has approved its merger with Mindtree. "Jalona has done a lot for the company and we are proud of him," Larsen & Toubro CEO SN Subrahmanyan said.

11.title: Russia will not use nuclear weapons in Ukraine: Foreign Ministry
11.article_body: The Russian Foreign Ministry on Friday said that Russia will not use nuclear weapons in Ukraine. Notably, the Russian Foreign Minister had earlier said that the West shouldn't underestimate elevated risks of nuclear conflict over Ukraine. On April 14, CIA Director William Burns had said that Russia may resort to use of potential "tactical nuclear weapons or low-yield nuclear weapons".

12.title: Shah Rukh Khan hosts diplomats at Mannat, pictures shared online
12.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan hosted diplomats, including the Consul General of Canada, France and others in Mumbai at his home Mannat. Canada's Consul General in Mumbai Diedrah Kelly shared pictures and tweeted, "I look forward to further strengthen ties...between Bollywood and the Canadian Film Industry." Jean-Marc Sere-Charlet, Consul General of France in Mumbai, also tweeted a picture with Shah Rukh.

13.title: People know our work: Bihar CM on Prashant Kishor's criticism of his govt
13.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Friday criticised political strategist Prashant Kishor for saying that the last 30 years under Lalu Prasad Yadav and Nitish Kumar had left Bihar as the most backward and poor state in the country. "Someone's opinion is not important," Kumar said. The CM added that people of the state know the work his government has done.

14.title: No COVID-19 death has gone uncounted in Delhi: Satyendar Jain
14.article_body: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain said no COVID-19 death in Delhi has gone uncounted. This comes a day after the World Health Organisation estimated that there were 47 lakh COVID-19 related deaths in India. "Delhi is the capital city of the country and is it possible that someone dies of COVID-19 here and doesn't get a death certificate?" Jain questioned.

15.title: Hyderabad Police conduct raids on 2 hookah parlours, 15 arrested
15.article_body: Hyderabad Police's Central Zone Team conducted raids on two hookah parlours in the city named The Dark 'O' Cafe and Snax Cafe. Fifteen people were arrested during the raids, Hyderabad Police tweeted. A press release stated that these hookah parlours were violating the rules under COTP Act and were charging higher prices for hookah pots.

16.title: Nearly 25 mn tonnes of grain stuck in Ukraine amid war: UN
16.article_body: UN food agency said nearly 25 million tonnes of grain are stuck in Ukraine and unable to leave the country because of infrastructure challenges and blockade of ports amid war. The blockages are responsible for high food prices, it added. Ukraine was the world's fourth-largest exporter of corn and sixth-largest exporter of wheat in 2020/21, International Grains Council data showed.

17.title: Delhi govt to develop a model park in every district: Gopal Rai
17.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Thursday chaired a meeting over the redevelopment of around 16,828 parks in the city. The minister said that under a pilot project, Delhi government will develop a park in every district in the national capital into a model park. The model parks will have amenities like pergolas, fountains, jogging tracks, open-air gyms and WiFi.

18.title: Anurag Basu trying to develop a two-hero script for Aamir, Ranbir: Report
18.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Basu is trying to develop a two-hero script for Aamir Khan and Ranbir Kapoor, according to a report. "While the basic idea has been conceptualised by Aamir Khan Productions, Basu...has come on board to weave a screenplay," the report stated. "If everything falls in right place, the film will take off sometime next year," the report further said.

19.title: Surprised MI dropped Brevis but glad they went back to David vs RR: Pollock
19.article_body: Ex-South Africa pacer Shaun Pollock said he was "surprised" but glad at MI's decision to replace  Dewald Brevis with Tim David against RR in IPL 2022. "You spend money...then give the guy [David] just two opportunities," he added. David scored an unbeaten nine-ball 20 in MI's five-wicket win over RR. Brevis has scored 124 runs in six matches so far.

20.title: Diagnostics platform Redcliffe Lifetech raises $61 million
20.article_body: Redcliffe Lifetech has raised $61 million led by LeapFrog Investments. HealthQuad, Schroders, LC Nueva, Spark Growth Ventures and existing investors Chiratae Ventures and Alkemi Venture Partners also participated in the funding round. Redcliffe delivers diagnostics services in 22 state-of-the-art labs across 14 cities. It raised $10 million in its Series A funding round last year.

21.title: 'Rambo' is very different from everything that I've done before: Tiger
21.article_body: Tiger Shroff, in a recent interview, opened up about his upcoming project 'Rambo' which is the Hindi adaptation of the 1982 Hollywood classic of the same name featuring Sylvester Stallone. "It's going to be very different from everything that I've done before," he said. According to reports, Tiger will start shooting for the film by the end of this year.

22.title: WHO data, Cong 'beta' both wrong: BJP on Rahul's remarks on COVID deaths
22.article_body: BJP on Friday reacted to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's criticism of Centre over the WHO's claim that India reported the highest number of COVID-related deaths. BJP's Sambit Patra said, "India has...robust mechanism for birth and death registration. WHO's data and...Congress' beta are wrong." WHO had claimed that India had 47 lakh COVID-related deaths, which's nearly 10 times the official figures.

23.title: Didn't try scoring anything but a single: Vettori on Kohli's 30 (33) vs CSK
23.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli's 30 off 33 balls in RCB's win against CSK by 13 runs, ex-RCB captain Daniel Vettori said, "At no stage did Kohli look like he was going for anything but a single." "Maybe the...run-out of Glenn Maxwell...put him back in his cage," added Vettori. Kohli has a strike rate of 111.91 in IPL 2022 currently.

24.title: Kohli was set to break Tendulkar's record but now bad form at peak: Latif
24.article_body: Former Pakistan skipper Rashid Latif has claimed that Virat Kohli was "set to break" Sachin Tendulkar's record of 100 international centuries before the former's "bad form" arrived. "The way Kohli used to perform...(he) was set to break Tendulkar's record with ease...He took it to the extreme. But now when he is dealing with bad form...that too has peaked," Latif said.

25.title: McCullum likely to become England's next white-ball coach: Reports
25.article_body: Former New Zealand skipper Brendon McCullum is reportedly the frontrunner in becoming  England's next white-ball coach. According to reports in the Daily Mail, McCullum has been "added to their (ECB) wishlist" along with former Proteas batter Gary Kirsten who is likely to become England's red-ball coach. Notably, the appointments were due after the axing of former head coach Chris Silverwood.

26.title: Private schools in Bengal asked to switch to online classes from May 7 amid heatwave
26.article_body: The West Bengal government has asked all private schools in the state to stop offline classes and switch to online classes from May 7, in view of the ongoing heatwave, an official said. "Private schools should not take any unilateral decision against the statement of Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on this issue," state School Education Department's Principal Secretary said.

27.title: Siraj is easily excitable, unable to plan as per the situation: WV Raman
27.article_body: Ex-India cricketer WV Raman said RCB pacer Mohammed Siraj is "easily excitable" and not experienced enough to plan what needs to be done as per the situation. "Siraj's ears will...hear a lot of things. He is trying to prove a lot of things to a lot of people," added Raman. Siraj has picked eight wickets in IPL 2022 so far.

28.title: Vaquita porpoise, with population of 10, could avoid extinction: Study
28.article_body: The world's smallest marine mammal, vaquita porpoise, has a chance of survival, despite numbering only about 10 in the wild. Genetic analysis by a team of UCLA biologists and colleagues has found that the species remains relatively healthy and can potentially survive if illegal "gillnet" fishing ceases promptly. "Vaquita is not doomed to extinction by genetics," UCLA's Christopher Kyriazis said.

29.title: Plea challenging Delhi University's offline exams dismissed by HC
29.article_body: The Delhi High Court quashed the plea which challenged the University of Delhi's February notice seeking the semester exams of all subjects in offline mode in May-June 2022. "This is not the right time to pass any order. However, the Court has given the liberty to petitioners to approach the court again," said Justice Rekha Palli while giving the judgement.

30.title: Nationwide strike in Sri Lanka demanding government to resign
30.article_body: Thousands of schools, factories, and businesses closed on Friday as public and private sector workers in Sri Lanka took part in a nationwide strike demanding President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's government's resignation over the worsening economic crisis. "We can pinpoint the policy blunders of the President that led to this very sorry state of our economy," trade union leader Ravi Kumudesh said.

31.title: I fail to understand why B'wood actors avoid doing guest appearances: Ajay
31.article_body: Ajay Devgn, who made guest appearances in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' and 'RRR', has said that he fails to understand why actors in Bollywood avoid doing guest roles, adding that Hollywood actors are always ready to make guest appearances in films. "According to me, small roles can outshine lead roles at times. So, why shouldn't I do such roles," Ajay further said.

32.title: Hardik can be picked purely as a bowler by any team in world: GT's Solanki
32.article_body: Gujarat Titans' Director of Cricket Vikram Solanki said the team's captain Hardik Pandya can be picked by any team in the world purely as a bowler. "Hardik is an exceptional cricketer with exceptional leadership qualities," added Vikram. Hardik has picked four wickets in nine IPL 2022 matches so far at an economy rate of 7.56 and bowling average of 35.

33.title: Who is Priyanka Mohite, the first Indian woman to scale 5 peaks above 8,000 metres?
33.article_body: Priyanka Mohite, who became the first Indian woman to scale five peaks above 8,000 metres after climbing Mount Kanchenjunga on Thursday, hails from Maharashtra's Satara. The 30-year-old is a postgraduate in biotechnology from Mumbai University and works as a research associate in Bengaluru. She's a recipient of Tenzing Norgay National Adventure Award 2020. She had scaled Mount Everest in 2013.

34.title: Ukraine starts fresh effort to evacuate civilians from Mariupol plant
34.article_body: A fresh attempt to evacuate scores of civilians trapped in the steel plant in Mariupol is underway, a senior Ukrainian official said on Friday. "Information about the results will be provided later," the official added. Notably, UN-brokered evacuations of some of the hundreds of civilians who had taken shelter in the plant were halted amid renewed fighting.

35.title: BJP's Tajinder Bagga tried to spread communal tension in Punjab: AAP
35.article_body: Hours after BJP leader Tajinder Bagga was arrested, AAP spokesperson Saurabh Bharadwaj said, "Through...his tweet, Bagga tried to spread communal tension and incite communal violence in Punjab." He claimed, "[Bagga's] USP is to speak dirty, poisonous...language...he makes two communities fight." Bharadwaj added, "BJP leaders in Delhi are trying to spread communal violence in Punjab."

36.title: Russian soldiers threaten to send heads of husbands in a box to Ukrainian women
36.article_body: Ukrainian women escaping from Mariupol have said that Russian soldiers threatened to murder their partners and send them their heads in a box. "Women who had acquaintances serving in the Ukrainian military or the police were threatened...They were promised that they would be sent their husband's head in a box," a woman said. She also said that they were strip-searched.

37.title: Had to call police: SRK's lookalike recalls getting mobbed during KKR match
37.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's lookalike Ibrahim Qadri, speaking to Humans of Bombay, recalled getting mobbed at a stadium during an IPL match between KKR and Gujarat Lions. "I got swamped and someone held onto me so tight that my t-shirt tore! It got so bad that I'd to call police...And after rescuing me, cops asked, 'SRK sir, ek selfie?'," he said.

38.title: They're self-made talents: Ranveer praises 'Jayeshbhai...' co-star, director
38.article_body: Ranveer Singh, in a recent interview, praised his 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' co-star Shalini Pandey and director Divyang Thakkar. "These are self-made talents that were...waiting to explode," he said, adding, "I'm...fortunate that I'm in...position to facilitate and empower that." Ranveer further said that he wants to give a platform to talented people with no godfathers to make a name in the industry.

39.title: BJP seeks CBI probe after worker's body found hanging in Kolkata; Shah visits his family
39.article_body: The BJP has demanded a CBI inquiry into the death of party worker Arjun Chowrasia, whose body was found hanging in Kolkata, Home Minister Amit Shah said. BJP said it has cancelled all celebrations scheduled to welcome Shah to Kolkata in light of the incident. Shah, who said he met the grieving family, claimed the deceased's grandmother was also beaten.

40.title: Was asked to pay ₹2,500 crore to become K'taka CM: BJP MLA; Cong demands probe
40.article_body: BJP MLA BR Patil (Yatnal) on Friday claimed he was asked to pay ₹2,500 crore to become the CM of Karnataka. "Don't believe these thieves who come making offers like they will get you a ticket, make you meet Sonia Gandhi or JP Nadda," Yatnal added, while addressing a party event. Congress' DK Shivakumar demanded a probe into Yatnal's allegations.

41.title: We have ads on condoms, why not film? Rakul on 'Chhatriwali'
41.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh, speaking about her upcoming film 'Chhatriwali', said the conversation around the use of condoms must be destigmatised. The actress added, "We have ads on protection so why not a film? That was the thought." Rakul will play a small-town girl who happens to stumble upon the job of the quality control head of a condom factory.

42.title: Thane man arrested for verbally abusing policeman on duty, biting him
42.article_body: A 30-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly verbally abusing and biting a policeman in Thane. According to police, the accused allegedly went up to the police jeep and banged his head on the windscreen and damaged it. The incident took place when a police team heard music being played in the Naupada area during patrolling and went to investigate.

43.title: 70-yr-old Pune man molests, rapes 3-yr-old girl residing in his building; arrested
43.article_body: A 70-year-old man was arrested for molesting and raping a three-year-old girl residing in his building in Pune. Police said the accused and the girl didn't know each other. "He lured the girl into his home and forced himself on her," a sub-inspector said. The girl narrated her ordeal to her mother when the latter found her without clothes.

44.title: Concerned about protecting people from COVID: Nitish on Shah's CAA remark
44.article_body: Reacting to Union Home Minister Amit Shah's CAA remark, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said, "It will be the decision of the Centre...coronavirus is still rising." "We are concerned regarding safeguarding the people from COVID," he added. Addressing a public rally in West Bengal, Amit Shah had said that Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) will be implemented the moment COVID-19 pandemic ends.

45.title: Climate change could spark next pandemic: Study
45.article_body: According to new study, the rising global temperature would lead to relocation of wild animals to areas with large human populations, thereby increasing the possibility of viral jump that could cause the next pandemic. The study stated that several mammals would encounter each other for the first time during such relocations called geographic range shifts and share thousands of viruses.

46.title: China builds permanent COVID testing stations for life after lockdown
46.article_body: China is setting up thousands of permanent PCR testing stations as authorities seek to "normalise" tough COVID-19 pandemic controls even after the current lockdowns end. According to officials, the stations will allow people to get tested in 15 minutes. Reportedly, the new system will make it a requirement for people to have a negative PCR test before entering public spaces.

47.title: Our career page has seen 8 lakh visits since WFH announcement: Airbnb
47.article_body: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky has said the firm's career page has been visited 8,00,000 times since it said it would have the option for employees to permanently work remotely. "The response internally was great, but even more impressive [was] the response externally," Chesky said. Airbnb said employees could move to anywhere in a country without a reduction in their compensation.

48.title: Power supply to over 3,200 slum dwellers cut off in Mumbai's Chembur
48.article_body: The power supply to over 3,200 slum dwellers was cut off in Mumbai's Chembur on Friday morning over non-payment of dues since 2005. The electricity dues have accrued to over ₹102 crore, a spokesperson for Adani Electricity said. "These defaulting consumers...are creating hindrance when our staff and partners visit door to door for collecting dues," the spokesperson added.

49.title: L&T Infotech announces merger with Mindtree
49.article_body: Larsen & Toubro Infotech (L&T Infotech) on Friday announced that its board has approved a scheme of amalgamation and arrangement with Mindtree. Under the scheme, L&T Infotech will issue 73 shares for every 100 shares of Mindtree. After the completion of the merger, Larsen & Toubro Limited will hold a 68.73% stake in 'LTIMindtree', the combined entity.

50.title: Musk told investors he could double their money if they backed Twitter deal: Report
50.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk told investors that he was highly confident he could double or triple their money if they backed his $44 billion buyout of Twitter, as per a report. He reportedly also said he could double Twitter's users to over 500 million by 2025. Musk is said to temporarily serve as Twitter CEO after the deal is closed.

51.title: Even I was under the impression that Hindi is the national language: Jaaved Jaaferi
51.article_body: While speaking on the national language debate, Jaaved Jaaferi said that he was also under the impression that Hindi is India's national language. "But I...looked up that the Constitution gives no language the status of a national language," he added. "There are so many religions but there's no national religion...You have a national bird or a national flower," said Jaaved.

52.title: 'We were under pressure', says Kane Williamson after loss to DC
52.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad skipper Kane Williamson admitted after their 21-run loss to the Delhi Capitals on Thursday that their side was "under pressure". "For us, it's just going back to the drawing board...We were put under pressure a lot in that first half and allowed them (DC) to get an above-par total," Williamson said.

53.title: One of the best innings for Delhi franchise: Pant on Warner's 92*(58)
53.article_body: After Delhi Capitals' opening batter David Warner scored 92*(58) against SunRisers Hyderabad on Thursday, skipper Rishabh Pant said that the Australian's knock was one of the "best" he has ever seen for the Delhi-based franchise. "The way he (Warner) batted, the way he paced the innings, it's one of the best innings I have seen," Pant said.

54.title: Mamata wants zero-opposition: Agnimitra Paul on BJP worker's death
54.article_body: West Bengal BJP's General Secretary Agnimitra Paul blamed TMC for the death of BJP worker Arjun Chowrasia in Kolkata and said that the murder of BJP worker is not a new thing and TMC would remove anyone who speaks against them. "One year after the elections when the Home Minister is coming, our worker has been murdered," Paul added.

55.title: Arvind Kejriwal is misusing his power: Bagga's mother on his arrest
55.article_body: The mother of BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga, who was arrested by Punjab Police, has accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of misusing his power. She said, "[Punjab Police] acted like 'hooligans', arrived in civil attire...took him away...They didn't even give time (to Bagga) to wear his turban." Bagga was arrested over his alleged threat to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal.

56.title: Man swallows jewellery worth ₹1.45 lakh along with biryani at Eid party in Chennai
56.article_body: A 32-year-old Chennai man allegedly swallowed jewellery worth ₹1.45 lakh before eating biryani at his fiancee's colleague's house during Eid party. Police said he confessed to swallowing the jewellery under the influence of alcohol, following which they took him to a hospital. He was reportedly given bananas and made to excrete the jewellery, which was handed over to the owner.

57.title: Malayalam actress Manju Warrier to star in Ajith Kumar's next: Report
57.article_body: Malayalam actress Manju Warrier has reportedly signed on to star opposite Ajith Kumar in his next film tentatively titled 'AK61'. According to reports, she will soon join the sets of the movie which is directed by H Vinoth and produced by Boney Kapoor. Notably, 'AK61' will be Manju Warrier's second Tamil film after Dhanush's 'Asuran'.

58.title: Reduce slavery to foreign goods, be vocal for local: PM Modi
58.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday urged citizens to reduce slavery to foreign goods and focus on the 'vocal for local' mantra. "Aatmanirbhar Bharat is our path as well as our resolve," Modi said while inaugurating the Jain International Trade Organisation's 'JITO Connect 2022' business meet. "We've to reduce dependence on foreign products. Find new destinations for export," he added.

59.title: Aus seeks 'strong friendship' with Solomon Islands despite China pact
59.article_body: Australian Defence Minister Peter Dutton said the country will continue having a "strong friendship" with the Solomon Islands despite it signing a security pact with China. Solomon Islands PM Manasseh Sogavare has been very clear that he isn't going to let China establish a military base on the islands and Australia is taking him at his word, Dutton added.

60.title: Govt orders all imported coal-based units to run at full capacity amid high demand
60.article_body: The government has invoked Section 11 of Electricity Act, mandating all imported coal-based power units to run at full capacity amid the ongoing power crisis in the country. "The demand for power has gone up by almost 20% in energy terms. The supply of domestic coal has increased but...it's not sufficient to meet increased demand for power," Power Ministry said.

61.title: 52-year-old Indian dies while trying to scale world's 3rd highest peak in Nepal
61.article_body: A 52-year-old Indian climber died near the summit of the world's third-highest peak Mount Kanchenjunga in Nepal on Thursday, the expedition's organisers have said. Narayanan Iyer breathed his last after collapsing at an altitude of 8,200 metres, they said. Two guides were assisting him in climbing, Pioneer Adventure's MD Nivesh Karki said.

62.title: Ram Charan's fans climb hotel walls to catch a glimpse of actor, video surfaces
62.article_body: Ram Charan was mobbed by fans upon his arrival in Visakhapatnam on Wednesday. A video of his fans climbing the walls of the hotel where the actor was staying to catch a glimpse of him has surfaced online. Charan reached Visakhapatnam to shoot for his upcoming project with Shankar. Tentatively titled 'RC 15', the film also stars Kiara Advani.

63.title: Adi Chopra turned floor of YRF into research wing: 'Prithviraj' director
63.article_body: The director of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Prithviraj' Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi has stated that producer Aditya Chopra turned an entire floor of the Yash Raj Films office into a research wing for the film. "I had personally worked on the script from 2004 to 2019 updating...every year...We kept the research bay fully operational till the last day of the shoot," Chandraprakash said.

64.title: I try to unite whole India: Ayushmann on being pan-India face of legacy brands
64.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana, speaking about being the pan-India face of legacy brands, stated that he has always tried to unite the whole of India through inclusive subjects and disruptive scripts and characters that challenge the status quo. "If I'm being viewed as someone who is contributing to sparking a dialogue...then I'm doing my job correctly," the actor said.

65.title: Person declared Indian once can't be declared foreigner later: Gauhati HC
65.article_body: A Foreigners' Tribunal bench of Gauhati High Court said that once the tribunal has declared a person to be an Indian, they cannot be declared a non-Indian if brought before it a second time. "A Foreigners' Tribunal only renders an opinion...it would be wrong to say that the Centre...would be bound by the opinion of the Tribunal," the court said.

66.title: Wristbands with caste identity not allowed in schools: TN's Theni District CEO
66.article_body: Chief Education Officer of Tamil Nadu's Theni ordered all school principals in the district to ensure coloured strings that indicate caste identity are not worn by the students. The order stated students will be severely punished if found inciting caste sectarianism. In April, a Tirunelveli student died after a clash with fellow students over wearing a wristband with caste identity.

67.title: Pune civic body may stop issuing new water connections: Official
67.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation plans to temporarily stop giving permission to new water connections to properties due to a water shortage, a PMC official said. "The...shortage...was expected due to...rising mercury levels and...expansion of city limits," the official added. "The situation would be reviewed by the end of this month and a final decision would be taken," the official further said.

68.title: Sonali repeats outfit she wore 16 yrs ago for an event with Pierce Brosnan, shares pics
68.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre, in an Instagram post, revealed that for Huma Qureshi's Eid party, she wore an outfit she first wore 16 years ago for an event with 'James Bond' actor Pierce Brosnan. "I wore this 16 years ago, during my first trimester," she wrote while sharing pictures. "Super happy that in this regard not much has changed," Sonali added.

69.title: Hotel shut after snake skin found in its newspaper wrapped food in Kerala
69.article_body: A hotel in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram has been temporarily shut after a customer allegedly found a part of a snake skin packed into her food. The snake skin was found in the newspaper that was used to pack the parottas, following which the food safety officials were alerted. The officials have also served a show-cause notice to the restaurant.

70.title: Pune man invests in fake forex trading firm, cheated of ₹21.66 lakh
70.article_body: A case has been filed after a 48-year-old man was cheated of ₹21.66 lakh by fraudsters who allegedly lured him into investing in a non-existent forex trading company, 'Tradeshotfx', in Pune. The complainant had come in contact with the accused through the internet and made the investments last year. The accused reportedly gave the complainant information showing profits he'd made.

71.title: Man seen duct-taped to plane seat in viral video jailed for groping crew's breasts in US
71.article_body: A passenger who was duct-taped to his seat for groping two flight attendants' breasts and punching one attendant mid-air has been jailed for 60 days in US' Ohio. A viral video of the incident showed the 23-year-old being bound to his seat on a Frontier Airlines flight. He was arrested by Miami Police after the plane landed.

72.title: Girl records video of father molesting her in Bihar to get him arrested; says 'he did it daily'
72.article_body: A girl has recorded a video of her father molesting her in Bihar's Samastipur to get him arrested. The girl, who said that her father allegedly "molested her daily", added that her mother held her responsible for the father's act. Police said that further investigation into the matter is underway.

73.title: Hardik would want to play at his best vs ex-team MI in IPL 2022: Gavaskar
73.article_body: Ahead of GT-MI in IPL 2022, Sunil Gavaskar said GT skipper Hardik Pandya would want to play at his best against MI as he wasn't retained by his ex-franchise in mega auction in February. "But he also owes so much to MI," he added. Gavaskar further said it won't be same as was the case for David Warner(92*) against SRH.

74.title: 2 dead after car hits motorbike in UP's Pratapgarh
74.article_body: Two people died while four others got injured after a car rammed into a motorbike in Uttar Pradesh's Pratapgarh on Friday. The two deceased, identified as Shailesh Kori (20) and Nirmala Devi (55), were going home on the bike when the accident took place, police said.  The car driver was allegedly under the influence of alcohol when detained, police said.

75.title: No ground for sedition against Maha MP Navneet Rana, husband Ravi Rana: Court
75.article_body: A court in Mumbai has said that there is no sufficient ground for invoking the charge of sedition against Maharashtra's Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her MLA-husband Ravi Rana. They have "undoubtedly crossed the line of freedom of speech", the court said. They were arrested after they announced to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside CM Uddhav Thackeray's private residence.

76.title: Fire breaks out at Calcutta High Court, no injuries reported
76.article_body: A minor fire broke out at a courtroom in Calcutta High Court around 10:45 am on Friday, police said. "Initially, there was a smell of burning electrical wires from the courtroom. It was evacuated immediately and the policemen posted there managed to douse the blaze," a police officer said. No injuries were reported in the incident.

77.title: Mrunal Thakur books 'Jersey' tickets for staff of coffee house in Mumbai
77.article_body: Mrunal Thakur recently visited a coffee house in Mumbai's Powai and booked tickets for her film 'Jersey' for the entire staff as a gesture for their hospitality. "The staff...was so sweet and generous in their hospitality and wished to see Jersey whenever they get time," the actress said, adding "It's incidents like these that...make me feel grateful."

78.title: Tomorrow's technology unveiled now with Ace EV: Tata Motors
78.article_body: Supported by the TATA UniEVerse and powered by the EVOGEN battery, the new Ace EV just got launched by Tata Motors. The company informed that the Ace EV is built for sustainable operations, reduced costs, and improved uptime through superior charging infrastructure, along with dedicated EV service and support centres.

79.title: B'luru sees rise in COVID containment zones as active cases cross 1,500
79.article_body: The number of containment zones in Bengaluru rose to nine on Thursday as active cases of coronavirus have crossed the 1,500-mark in the city. Mahadevpura has the most number of containment zones at four. The number of daily coronavirus cases recorded in Bengaluru Urban has increased in the past five days by nearly 83.9% to 171 on Thursday, data said.

80.title: WhatsApp working on feature to allow group admins to delete others' texts: Report
80.article_body: Meta owned WhatsApp is working on a new feature that will enable group admins to delete messages posted by other members on the group, as per a report. The move will reportedly enable admins to act as moderators of a group. Apart from this, WhatsApp is also working on extending the time to delete a message for everybody.

81.title: 398 kids rescued from Pune railway station, reunited with families
81.article_body: At least 398 children, who had run away from their homes, were rescued from the Pune railway station between April 2021 and March 2022, a report stated. Railways officials said that after counselling and help from the administration, the rescued children were reunited with their families and relatives. Out of the total children, 303 were boys, and 95 were girls.

82.title: 2 held in Punjab for alleged links with Khalistani terrorists
82.article_body: Two people were arrested from Punjab's Ferozepur and Faridkot districts for their alleged links with the four suspected Khalistani terrorists arrested on Thursday for carrying ammunition in Haryana's Karnal. The two suspects, identified as Akashdeep and Jashandeep, are accomplices of the four suspected terrorists linked to Pakistan-based Babbar Khalsa terrorist Harwinder Singh Rinda, police said.

83.title: Begged onlookers for help, no one came: Wife of man lynched by her relatives in Hyd
83.article_body: The Muslim wife of 25-year-old Hindu man Nagaraju who was allegedly lynched by her relatives on a busy road in Hyderabad said she had "begged and pleaded" onlookers for help. "The attack went on for 15-20 minutes, but no one helped," said Sulthana. "If the onlookers had helped, my husband would be alive today," she added.

84.title: Will Smith in therapy after Oscars slapping incident: Report
84.article_body: Actor Will Smith has been going to therapy after the 2022 Oscars slapping incident, reported Entertainment Tonight. The actor slapped comedian Chris Rock onstage after the latter made a joke about his wife Jada Pinkett Smith's alopecia. Will had later apologised for the incident in an Instagram post. He made his first public appearance at Mumbai airport on April 23.

85.title: EV-charging hub set up at B'luru mall, 50 cars can be charged at one time
85.article_body: Fortum Charge & Drive India has commissioned a public electric vehicle (EV)-charging hub at Forum Neighbourhood Mall in Bengaluru. According to the company, the charging hub will cater to all types of electric cars and compatible three-and two-wheelers and can charge 50 cars at one time. The company is planning to set up 200 EV charging points across the city.

86.title: 1971 war finest example of whole-of-govt approach towards national security: Rajnath
86.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that the 1971 Indo-Pakistani war was the finest example of the whole-of-government approach not only for armed forces but also for national security. Speaking at PC Lal Memorial Lecture, he said, "It's not always necessary to have more expensive weapon systems. It is the employment of weapon systems that gives us an edge in wars."

87.title: He could've got 6 runs in another over: Yuvraj on declaration when Sachin was on 194*
87.article_body: Talking about Rahul Dravid declaring India's innings against Pakistan in 2004 Multan Test when Sachin Tendulkar was batting on 194*(348), Yuvraj Singh said, "We got a message...that we had to play fast and we were going to declare." "He could have got those six runs in another over...I don't think another two overs would've made a difference," Yuvraj added.

88.title: He said 'That's not how cricket is played': Powell on offering Warner chance to hit 100
88.article_body: DC's Rovman Powell revealed that before the start of last over against SRH, he asked David Warner if he wanted a single to try to get a hundred. "Warner said, 'Listen...that's not how cricket is played. You should try to smack it as hard as...possible'," Powell said. Powell scored 18 runs in last over, while Warner remained unbeaten on 92.

89.title: Xiaomi allowed to operate seized assets worth ₹5,551 crore by K'taka HC
89.article_body: Karnataka High Court has stayed the ED's decision to seize ₹5,551.27 crore from Xiaomi Technology India Private Limited's bank accounts for suspected violations of foreign exchange laws. The court has allowed Xiaomi to operate its seized accounts for day to day activities. The company earlier said its "royalty payments and statements to the bank are all legit and truthful".

90.title: Only 23 of India's 100 unicorn startups are profitable: Report
90.article_body: Only 23 of the 100 unicorns (startups with a valuation of $1 billion or above) in India have achieved profitability for a financial year, Moneycontrol reported citing data from Tracxn Technologies. These startups have raised over $80 billion from investors to date, it added. The list of profitable unicorn startups includes Zerodha, Nykaa, Zoho, Lenskart, CoinSwitch Kuber, Mamaearth and Shiprocket.

91.title: People ask ridiculous rapid-fire questions; what are we, teenagers? Radhika
91.article_body: Actress Radhika Apte has stated that people ask "some ridiculous questions" during rapid-fire question and answer rounds. She was giving an interview which included a rapid-fire round. The actress added that there are questions like choosing between this person or that person. "You can't choose from two actors you've worked with. What is this, what are we, teenagers?" she said.

92.title: Police officers help woman deliver baby at Prayagraj rly station
92.article_body: Two female police officers, who are part of the 'Operation Meri Saheli' team, helped a woman deliver her baby girl at the platform of a railway station in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj. A public relations officer said that the woman was about to board a train when she started experiencing labour pains. The woman and her husband thanked the railway authorities.

93.title: Biden's daughter won't travel to Europe after COVID-19 contact
93.article_body: US President Joe Biden's daughter, Ashley Biden, will not travel to Europe with the First Lady after coming into contact with a coronavirus-infected person, the White House said. The 40-year-old has tested negative for COVID-19, it added. First Lady Jill Biden left the US on Thursday for Romania and Slovakia, where she'll highlight US commitment to Ukrainian refugees.

94.title: He called me sl*t, kicked me: Amber as she claims Depp accused her of affair with Franco
94.article_body: Amber Heard testified about an incident in which Johnny Depp allegedly slapped and kicked her on an airplane after accusing her of having an affair with James Franco. "He hated, hated James Franco...He called me a sl*t," she recalled. Members of Depp's security team and his assistants were on the plane, she said, adding that "no one said anything".

95.title: Over half of BSES consumers in Delhi got no power bill since 2019: Data
95.article_body: Over half of the BSES consumers in Delhi did not have to pay power bills since the implementation of Delhi government's scheme in 2019, that gives free power to those consuming less than 200 units of electricity per month, according to data. From 2021 to February this year, the percentage of consumers falling under the 200-unit slab was 52.8%.

96.title: You set high benchmark: Jet Airways' CEO as IndiGo congratulates it on test flight
96.article_body: After IndiGo congratulated Jet Airways on its test flight on Thursday, Jet Airways' CEO Sanjiv Kapoor thanked its competitor airline and said, "You guys have set the benchmark really high." He added, "[You've] shown what's achievable by an (Indian) airline...in terms of size, scale and consistency of operations with...focus on basics." Jet Airways is in the process of relaunching operations.

97.title: Always said yes to woman-centric films as tribute to my mother: Arjun Rampal
97.article_body: Actor Arjun Rampal revealed he has always said yes to any woman-centric film he has been approached with. "That's my way of giving tribute to my mother because I know how much strength she had," Arjun added. Notably, Arjun's upcoming film, 'Dhaakad', is also a woman-centric film wherein Kangana Ranaut will be seen playing the lead role.

98.title: Monkey fled with evidence: Rajasthan police to court hearing 2016 murder case
98.article_body: On being asked by a court to produce evidence in a 2016 murder case, the Rajasthan police said a monkey fled with it. They also blamed a constable for this, who was suspended and later retired and died. The bag containing the murder weapon and other evidence was reportedly kept under a tree as the police station had no space.

99.title: Man beaten to death for using loudspeaker at temple in Gujarat
99.article_body: A 40-year-old man died after he and his brother were allegedly beaten with sticks by members of their own community for using loudspeaker while performing aarti at a temple in Gujarat's Mehsana. The deceased's brother claimed that when they refused a person's request to stop using the loudspeaker, the latter and four others attacked them. The incident occurred on Wednesday.

100.title: Shashi Tharoor pens poem after man's 'Chochi airport, egg water' tweet goes viral
100.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor penned a poem after a man tweeted, "If you are in Chochi kindly be aware of airport lounge named Earth Lounge...they use egg water to bake...dosa." "In 'Chochi', an outraged young vegan. Reacted as if shot with a ray-gun. Hearing 'thanda' as 'anda'. He 'baked' a huge blunder. Should've stuck to chawal & baingan!" Tharoor wrote.

101.title: Reality check, have to use your mind: RP Singh on Umran's 52-run spell vs DC
101.article_body: Discussing SRH pacer Umran Malik's spell against DC where he conceded 52 runs without picking a wicket, ex-India pacer RP Singh said, "You [have]...pace...but you also need...use of the mind to go with that." "This was a massive reality check," added Singh. "Umran got a substantial drubbing," stated Singh. "[He] isn't properly prepared yet...and...[needs] to improve a lot," he said.

102.title: Major fire breaks out at chemical plant in Gujarat's Ankleshwar; 6 injured
102.article_body: At least six workers were injured after a massive fire broke out at the factory of chemical manufacturer United Phosphorus Limited (UPL) in Gujarat's Ankleshwar on Friday morning. Fire tenders were rushed to the spot soon after the fire officials received a distress call regarding the fire around 7 am. The injured persons were rushed to a nearby hospital.

103.title: Germany to supply Ukraine with 7 self-propelled howitzers
103.article_body: The German government on Friday said it will supply Ukraine with seven self-propelled howitzers, which reach a firing distance between 30 to 40 kilometres, amid its war with Russia. The training of Ukrainian troops on the artillery weapons could start next week in Germany, German Defence Minister Christine Lambrecht said. Earlier, the Dutch government had pledged five howitzers to Ukraine.

104.title: Tesla aims to run two shifts at Shanghai plant from May 16: Report
104.article_body: Tesla is aiming to run two shifts at its Shanghai plant from May 16, Reuters reported citing an internal memo. It plans to produce 2,600 electric cars from the Shanghai plant per day from then. Earlier, Tesla said it will turn Shanghai into "the world's largest vehicle export hub" with a new factory capable of producing 4,50,000 EVs per year.

105.title: Akshay lends his voice to trailer of Ganesh Acharya's 'Dehati Disco'
105.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar has lent his voice to the trailer of Ganesh Acharya's upcoming film 'Dehati Disco'. "When he came to know that I am making a film based on dance, he wanted to support the film in every way," Ganesh Acharya said about Akshay. Directed by Manoj Sharma, the film features Ganesh Acharya and Ravi Kishan in key roles.

106.title: Started working on 'Laal...' 14 yrs ago, it has been quite a journey: Aamir
106.article_body: Aamir Khan, in his podcast titled 'Laal Singh Chaddha Ki Kahaniyaan', revealed that he started working on the movie 14 years ago. "In June-July, [it] will complete 14 years, since we started it. It has been quite a journey. First few years, we were running behind the rights," he said. It's a remake of the 1994 American film 'Forrest Gump'.

107.title: SpaceX 'Crew-3' led by Indian-American Raja Chari returns from ISS
107.article_body: SpaceX's Crew-3 led by Indian-American Raja Chari has returned after a six-month mission aboard ISS. The crew consisted of American spaceflight veteran Tom Marshburn, and three first-time astronauts, NASA's Raja Chari, Kayla Barron, and ESA's Matthias Maurer. Crew-3 returned to Earth with some 250 kilograms of cargo, including loads of ISS research samples.

108.title: Locals mistake lion printed bag as stray lion in Kenya, wildlife service shares pics
108.article_body: Locals in Meru County, located near Mt Kenya National Park, alerted the Kenya Wildlife Service about a stray lion hiding in the bushes after they mistook a supermarket bag with a lion's picture printed on it. The wildlife service tweeted pictures of the bag which contained avocado seedlings and praised the public for their alertness.

109.title: Downey Jr remembers assistant Jimmy on his death anniversary, shares old pics
109.article_body: Robert Downey Jr took to his Instagram handle on Thursday to remember his personal assistant Jimmy Rich on the latter's first death anniversary. He shared several candid photos and some video clips of Jimmy, writing, "For...1 year anniversary of Jimmy's cosmic mic drop, I felt...need to share a glimpse into his lightning wit, huge heart, and at times, profound simplicity."

110.title: Mumbai man molests 44-year-old British woman at Bandra club; held
110.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested a 35-year-old-man for allegedly molesting a 44-year-old British national at a club in Bandra on Tuesday. "When the woman went to the washroom, the...accused molested her...[she] then returned to her table and narrated the incident to her husband and friends, following which they ran towards the accused and caught hold of him," a police official said.

111.title: Who are the highest run-scorers and wicket-takers in IPL 2022 after 50 matches?
111.article_body: Following the conclusion of 50 matches in IPL 2022, RR opener Jos Buttler has scored the most runs in the tournament so far, with 588 runs. He's followed by LSG captain KL Rahul (451) and PBKS opener Shikhar Dhawan (369). Meanwhile, RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal is the highest wicket-taker with 19 scalps, followed by DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav (18 wickets).

112.title: Which states have fertility rate above replacement level as total rate falls to 2.0?
112.article_body: India's Total Fertility Rate, an average number of children per woman, has declined to 2.0. There are five states which are above replacement level of fertility of 2.1 - Bihar (2.98), Meghalaya (2.91), UP (2.35), Jharkhand (2.26) and Manipur (2.17). According to UN, countries experiencing below-replacement fertility, indicates that a generation is not producing enough children to replace itself.

113.title: Sonali repeats 16-yr-old outfit she wore for an event with Brosnan, shares pics
113.article_body: Sonali Bendre took to Instagram to share a picture of herself from Huma Qureshi's Eid party and revealed that she repeated the outfit that she wore 16 years ago at an event with 'James Bond' actor Pierce Brosnan. "Wore this 16 years ago, during my first trimester while carrying Ranveer Behl...Happy that in this regard not much has...changed," Sonali added.

114.title: J&K Congress calls delimitation panel report 'politically motivated'
114.article_body: J&K Congress on Thursday termed the report by Delimitation Commission as "biased", "faulty" and "politically motivated". "The commission has neglected fundamental principles...ignored the aspirations of people and did great injustice to different...communities," said J&K Congress chief spokesman Ravinder Sharma. As per the report, 43 assembly seats have been allotted to Jammu and 47 to Kashmir.

115.title: Such misuse of police never done in India's history: Mishra on Bagga's arrest
115.article_body: BJP leader Kapil Mishra on Friday reacted to party spokesperson Tajinder Bagga's arrest by Punjab Police, claiming that around 50 police officers had arrested him from his house. He also claimed that such "misuse" of police over a tweet has never been done in India's history. "[Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal] has become scared of a true sardar," he said.

116.title: Govt aims to boost coal output by 100 mn tonnes, reopen closed mines: Official
116.article_body: India is looking to boost its coal output by 75-100 million tonnes in the next two-to-three years by restarting closed mines, Coal Secretary Dr AK Jain said amid reports of power crisis in the country. Coal India, which produces 80% of India's coal, plans to increase annual output to one billion tonnes by 2024, from the current 622.6 million tonnes.

117.title: WB BJP worker's body found hanging in abandoned building ahead of Shah's visit
117.article_body: A West Bengal BJP worker's body was found hanging in an abandoned building near his home ahead of Union Home Minister Amit Shah's visit to Kolkata. The deceased, identified as Arjun Chowrasia, was a member of the BJP's youth wing. Notably, Chowrasia was scheduled to lead a bike rally in one of the events planned for Shah's welcome.

118.title: Revenge time, 2018 final loss was very sad: Salah on CL final vs Madrid
118.article_body: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah said his team will look to get revenge against Real Madrid in their upcoming Champions League final, having been defeated 1-3 in the final of the tournament's 2018 edition. "It was a very sad day for...us," added Salah. Liverpool defeated Villarreal 5-2 on aggregate to enter their third Champions League final in five years.

119.title: It’d be atomic bomb on economy: Hungary rejects EU sanctions on Russia
119.article_body: Hungarian PM Viktor Orban said that his country wouldn't support the European Union's new sanctions package against Russia. The European Commission's current proposal banning Russian oil imports would amount to an "atomic bomb" dropped on the Hungarian economy, he added. However, Orban said Hungary was ready to negotiate if it sees a new proposal that would meet Hungarian interests.

120.title: Car jumps over divider, collides with mini-bus in B'luru; 2 dead
120.article_body: Two people, aged 22 and 18, were killed after the car they were in jumped over the divider, hit another car and then collided head-on with a mini-bus on Bengaluru's NICE Road on Thursday. One of the deceased, who was driving the car, reportedly lost control after a tyre burst while he was overspeeding. The mini-bus driver was injured.

121.title: Science doesn't lie, Modi does: Rahul Gandhi on WHO's COVID-19 deaths
121.article_body: A day after the World Health Organization (WHO) claimed that India reported highest death due to COVID-19, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the central government and said, "Science doesn't LIE. Modi does." Taking to Twitter, Rahul said, "47 lakh Indians died due to the Covid pandemic. NOT 4.8 lakh." "Support them with the mandated ₹4 lakh compensation," Rahul told Centre.

122.title: One of Nadal's big things is his aggression during matches: Andy Roddick
122.article_body: Talking about Rafael Nadal, former world number one Andy Roddick said, "One of Rafa's big things is he can get into...matches and the aggression will come, him opening up the shoulders and bullying people will come." "He looks like a guy that hasn't played a tournament in a while but you don't...worry about him on the clay," added Roddick.

123.title: Mumbai man takes life as recovery agents harass him for loan he never took
123.article_body: A 38-year-old man in Mumbai died by suicide after being reportedly harassed by recovery agents of an instant loan app for recovery of a loan. The agents allegedly threatened him to pay back the loan, although he repeatedly told them he hadn't taken any loan. They also sent his morphed nude photos to his colleagues and relatives before his death.

124.title: Ex-sarpanch shot at, attacked during fight at restaurant in Pune
124.article_body: A former sarpanch is undergoing treatment at a hospital after he was injured during a fight between two groups at a restaurant in Pune's Manjri. The main accused allegedly shot at the former sarpanch, hit him on the head with a brick and threatened to see who would intervene. The incident took place around 12.45 am on Wednesday.

125.title: Jamia researchers develop tool to decipher neurological disorders
125.article_body: An optogenetic tool has been developed by the researchers of Jamia Millia Islamia's Multidisciplinary Centre for Advanced Research and Studies (MCARS). Notably, the tool has the potential to assist in understanding various neurological disorders like Alzheimer's disease, schizophrenia and depression. The research has been done in collaboration with the US-based National Institutes of Health.

126.title: Lunar soil can be used to make oxygen & fuel on moon: Study
126.article_body: Scientists have found that the lunar soil brought back by China's Chang'e-5 spacecraft contains iron-rich and titanium-rich substances that could work as catalysts to convert carbon dioxide into oxygen and generate hydrocarbons like methane that can be used as fuel. The researchers are exploring if these resources can be used to support human life on the moon and in space.

127.title: Pics of blood-stained furniture, guitar, walls surface amid Depp and Heard's trial
127.article_body: During Johnny Depp's defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard, the court was shown pictures of blood around house after an alleged fight between the two. Amber's team claimed the pictures were taken after Depp allegedly physically abused her in Australia in 2015.  The images showed blood on a sofa, white sheets and a guitar.

128.title: Asian Games 2022 postponed amid COVID-19 crisis in China
128.article_body: The Asian Games 2022, which were due to take place in China's Hangzhou in September, have been postponed indefinitely, organisers said. This comes as China is battling a new wave of COVID-19 driven by the Omicron variant. Notably, the host city of Hangzhou lies near Shanghai, which has endured a weeks-long lockdown as part of China's zero-tolerance approach to coronavirus.

129.title: Zomato CEO to donate ESOP proceeds for education of delivery agents' kids
129.article_body: Zomato's CEO Deepinder Goyal will be donating all his employee stock option plan (ESOP) proceeds worth ₹700 crore to Zomato Future Foundation (ZFF). ZFF will cover the education of up to two children of delivery agents of Zomato. This entails up to ₹50,000 cover per child annually for agents who have been with Zomato for more than five years.

130.title: UP govt to provide free WiFi at all 58,189 gram panchayat secretariats
130.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government announced that it will soon provide free WiFi facilities in all its 58,000 gram panchayats. The facility would be provided within a 50-metre radius of village secretariats. The move to set up free WiFi would give a fillip to boost "economic activity", exploring the "hidden potential" of villages and the residents, the state government said.

131.title: 20-yr-old woman murdered inside home, jewellery stolen in Ghaziabad
131.article_body: A 20-year-old woman was allegedly strangled to death with a wire inside her home and jewellery was stolen by unidentified robbers in Ghaziabad, police said. The victim's 70-year-old mother-in-law was present in the house when the incident happened and was assaulted by the accused, police added. The family suspects involvement of daily wage labourers working in their house, police stated.

132.title: Delhi Police registers kidnapping case after BJP's Bagga arrested by Punjab Police
132.article_body: Delhi Police has registered a kidnapping case after arrest of BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga by Punjab Police over his alleged threat to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. Bagga was arrested from his Delhi residence. Punjab Police said it had intimated Janakpuri police station before arresting Bagga, who had failed to appear before the police, despite being served five notices.

133.title: Punjab Police dragged my son out of the house, punched me: BJP leader Bagga's father
133.article_body: The father of BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga, who was arrested by Punjab Police from his Delhi residence, has said, "10-15 police personnel came to our home and dragged Tajinder out." "When I picked up my mobile phone to record a video of the incident, police took me to another room and punched me in the face," he added.

134.title: Couple dies by suicide after poisoning their children in Chhattisgarh
134.article_body: A couple died allegedly by suicide after poisoning their two minor children in Chhattisgarh's Kanker, police said. The husband and wife were found hanging from the ceiling fan in a hotel room and their kids were found dead on the bed, police added. The incident came to light when a hotel employee knocked on the door and no one responded.

135.title: He is currently better than me: Rafael Nadal on Spain's Carlos Alcaraz
135.article_body: Rafael Nadal said fellow Spaniard Carlos Alcaraz is currently better than him, adding that it will be "very, very tough" to face him. "I am a very realistic person," stated Nadal. "Alcaraz is in a better physical state of mind [and] is more fit," said Nadal. Nadal will take on Alcaraz in the quarter-finals of the Madrid Open 2022.

136.title: Cyberabad Police arrests 4 drug peddlers with ganja worth ₹15 lakh
136.article_body: Cyberabad Police on Thursday arrested four drug peddlers and seized 104 kg of ganja worth ₹15 lakh from their possession. Acting on a tip-off, police intercepted a car at Mahadevapuram X Road and arrested the accused. They were reportedly transporting the contraband from Chinturu in Visakhapatnam to KPHB Colony. Two of the accused are farmers from Visakhapatnam, police said.

137.title: 'Pushpa' actors Allu Arjun, Rashmika to appear on Koffee with Karan: Report
137.article_body: 'Pushpa: The Rise' actors Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna will reportedly appear together on the upcoming season of the talk show 'Koffee with Karan', hosted by filmmaker Karan Johar. "This season, 'Koffee with Karan' will witness a few big South celebrities, the makers have kept it well balanced to attract South audiences," Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying.

138.title: Journalist found dead in a bag in Mexico; 9th to be killed this year
138.article_body: A veteran Mexican journalist was found dead in the northwestern state of Sinaloa on Thursday, authorities said. Luis Enrique Ramirez was the ninth journalist to be killed in the country this year. Ramirez's body was reportedly discovered by security forces in a black bag and wrapped in plastic. Mexico is believed to be one of the "deadliest" countries for journalists.

139.title: Zomato shares hit an all-time low of ₹57.65; fall below issue price
139.article_body: Shares of Zomato dipped to an all-time low of ₹57.65 during intraday trade on Friday on BSE. While its issue price was ₹76, Zomato's stock price had touched an all-time high of ₹169.10 on November 16, 2021. Currently trading 66% below its all-time high price, Zomato shares have fallen over 57% on a year-to-date basis.

140.title: People want BJP's double engine govt in T'gana: BJP chief JP Nadda
140.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party's (BJP) National President JP Nadda on Thursday said the people of Telangana want change in the state, adding, "They want BJP's double engine government." "KCR Ji has gone disturbed due to BJP winning in Dubbaka (bypoll in 2020) and Huzurabad (bypoll in 2021)," Nadda said while addressing the crowd at Mahabubnagar in Telangana.

141.title: Raj has loudspeaker issue now as brother Uddhav is Maha CM: Raut
141.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Thursday claimed that MNS chief Raj Thackeray never had any issue over loudspeakers before, but "he has this issue now because his brother (Uddhav Thackeray) is the CM of Maharashtra." Earlier, Raj had shared videos of the late Bal Thackeray speaking on the loudspeaker issue. "Politics is being done everywhere about loudspeakers," Raut added.

142.title: Struggled mentally, emotionally after returning from Australia: Djokovic
142.article_body: Talking about being deported from Australia in January having been unvaccinated against COVID-19, Novak Djokovic said, "This was something that was completely unexpected. So it did take a toll on me...mentally [and] emotionally." "It was the kind of circumstance or situation I had never faced in my life before," added Djokovic. "I felt I [was]...more nervous than usual," stated Djokovic.

143.title: Heard breaks down recalling Depp 'penetrating' her with bottle, says 'Couldn't breathe'
143.article_body: Actress Amber Heard broke down in the court while stating that her ex-husband, actor Johnny Depp, penetrated her with a vodka bottle after getting drunk in 2015 in Australia. She stated, "I've never been so scared in my...life...I couldn't breathe. I just remember thinking, 'Please God...please...I hope it's not broken.'" Heard was testifying in Depp's defamation trial against her.

144.title: Depp was in a relationship with a woman, went to her house just after marriage: Heard
144.article_body: Amber Heard has testified that Johnny Depp cheated on her with another woman just after the former couple got married. "He had gone to her house right after we got married, like upon touching down in Los Angeles, I think it was the next day he went to this woman's house, who he [had] a sexual relationship with," she said.

145.title: Karnataka govt gives nod for construction of Anubhava Mantapa
145.article_body: The Karnataka government has approved the project for the construction of Anubhava Mantapa in Basavakalyan, a significant site for the Lingayat community, located in Karnataka's Bidar district. The decision was taken in a Basavakalyan Development Board meeting chaired by CM Basavaraj Bommai. Notably, 12th-century reformer Basaveshwara tried to eradicate social inequities through Anubhava Mantapa.

146.title: Kedarnath Temple opens for devotees today, CM Dhami offers prayers
146.article_body: The doors of Uttarakhand's Kedarnath Temple, one of the country's 12 Jyotirlingas, were opened for pilgrims today. CM Pushkar Singh Dhami along with his wife Geeta Dhami offered prayers during the door opening occasion. On May 3, portals of Gangotri and Yamunotri temples were opened on Akshaya Tritiya, which also marked the start of the Char Dham Yatra 2022.

147.title: Rapper Post Malone expecting 1st child with long-time girlfriend
147.article_body: Rapper Austin Richard Post, professionally known as Post Malone, revealed in an interview that he's expecting his first child with his long-time girlfriend. He added that he's excited for this next chapter in his life. "I'm...happiest I've ever been, and for since I could remember I was sad," he said. The rapper hasn't disclosed the identity of his girlfriend yet.

148.title: We encouraged Musk to buy Twitter: Trump's Truth Social CEO
148.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's venture Truth Social CEO Devin Nunes in an interview said, "We encouraged Elon Musk to buy it [Twitter] because someone has to continue to take on these tech tyrants." "President Trump, basically before Elon Musk bought it, actually said to go and buy it," Nunes added. Nunes expressed that Musk will create a "different" Twitter.

149.title: WhatsApp group warns K'taka Muslim women will be attacked for removing burqa
149.article_body: A WhatsApp group named 'Muslim Defense Force' has allegedly sent threatful messages to parents of Muslim women in Karnataka's Mangaluru, asking them to keep an eye on their children. "They are saying...Muslim women who wear a burqa in public places should not take it out to take photographs...or they will be attacked," police said, adding they are monitoring the situation.

150.title: Policeman arrested, suspended from duty for raping tribal woman in Raj
150.article_body: A 59-year-old Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) was arrested and suspended from duty for allegedly raping a 25-year-old tribal woman in Rajasthan's Jhalawar, police said. ASI was investigating a case that the rape victim had filed against her in-laws, police added. He called her on Monday, took her to a forest area on his motorcycle and allegedly raped her, police stated.

151.title: DiDi Prez, Lenovo founder go private on Chinese social media platform
151.article_body: The President of Chinese ride-hailing giant DiDi Chuxing Jean Liu and her father Liu Chuanzhi, the founder of Lenovo, have gone private on the Chinese social media platform Weibo. Earlier, both Jean and her father switched on a function on Weibo to hide all old posts. Neither had posted on the platform in the past six months.

152.title: Sensex falls over 1,000 points to trade below 55,000; Nifty slips below 16,400
152.article_body: The Sensex fell over 1,000 points to 54,668, while the NSE Nifty plunged 316 points to 16,366 during the intraday trade on Friday. Among the Sensex-30 shares, Bajaj Twins, Maruti, Wipro, Ultratech Cement, HCL Tech, Axis Bank, and Infosys were down up to 3%. Owing to weak global cues, the domestic markets had opened over 1.5% lower on Friday.

153.title: Daily COVID-19 cases in B'luru Urban rise by 83.9% to 171 in 5 days
153.article_body: The number of daily coronavirus cases recorded in Bengaluru Urban has increased in the past five days by nearly 83.9% to 171 on Thursday, according to Karnataka health department data. The number of daily cases reported in the city on May 1 was 93. Furthermore, the city has reported no deaths due to coronavirus in the past five days.

154.title: US is not providing Ukraine intel to kill Russian generals: Pentagon
154.article_body: The Pentagon has denied that the country had provided intelligence on the locations of Russian generals on the battlefield so that Ukrainian forces could kill them. The US only "provides battlefield intelligence to help Ukrainians defend their country", Pentagon Press Secretary John Kirby said. Ukraine makes its own decisions on whether to target a Russian leader or not, he added.

155.title: People called me the oldest newcomer: Sanjay Kapoor on 27 yrs of 'Prem'
155.article_body: Sanjay Kapoor on Thursday shared a post on Instagram marking the 27th anniversary of his debut film 'Prem'. Sharing an old picture with co-star Tabu, he wrote, "This...picture was taken...in 1990...had to wait for 3 years for...next schedule in 1993, the wait was extremely tough...people called me...oldest newcomer...Stayed positive and after 32 years I'm still doing what I love doing."

156.title: 49-yr-old man kills wife, lover with screwdriver in Hyderabad; arrested
156.article_body: Hyderabad police have arrested a 49-year-old man for killing his wife and her lover. The husband reportedly knew about his wife's affair and had warned her. On Sunday, the three went to the outskirts of the city where the accused attacked his wife and her lover with boulders and screwdriver after seeing them in an intimate position, police said.

157.title: Blue Corner notice issued against rape-accused actor Vijay Babu
157.article_body: A Blue Corner notice has been issued against actor Vijay Babu following a request by Kochi Police, who are probing a rape case against him. A Blue Corner notice is issued by Interpol to collect additional information from its member countries about a person's identity, location or activities in relation to a crime. Vijay is believed to be in Dubai.

158.title: Saudi Prince replies to Musk's 'How much of Twitter does the Kingdom own?' tweet
158.article_body: Saudi Prince Alwaleed bin Talal Al Saud has replied after Elon Musk asked, "How much of Twitter does the Kingdom own, directly & indirectly?" "I believe you will be an excellent leader for Twitter. Kingdom Holding Company and I look forward to roll our ~$1.9billion in the 'new' Twitter," Alwaleed tweeted. Earlier, Alwaleed opposed Musk's offer to buy Twitter.

159.title: Swiggy agent books Dunzo to deliver man's order in B'luru, chat goes viral
159.article_body: A Twitter user in Bengaluru shared a screenshot of his chat where he revealed that while he had ordered coffee via Swiggy, the delivery agent booked a Dunzo delivery partner to deliver the item. Reacting to his tweet that is now going viral, Dunzo replied, "In the @peakbengaluru metaverse of madness, Bichoo gang and Eagle gang work together."

160.title: People who backstabbed Balasaheb are now telling us about his thoughts: Raut
160.article_body: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut criticised MNS chief Raj Thackeray and said, "Those people who backstabbed [Bal Thackeray] are now telling us about his thoughts and ideology." "These people have forgotten that today namaz is not offered on roads," Raut added. His statement comes after Raj Thackeray shared an old video of Bal Thackeray's speech on the removal of loudspeakers.

161.title: Andhra man carries 8-yr-old son's body on bike after being denied ambulance
161.article_body: A man was forced to carry his eight-year-old son's body on a motorbike to reach home after the hospital allegedly denied him an ambulance in Andhra Pradesh's Nellore. TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu shared a video of the incident on Twitter, calling it a "horrifying episode of apathy and indifference". A similar incident had also occurred last week in Tirupati.

162.title: Man posing as minister's nephew dupes job aspirants across Mumbai, Thane
162.article_body: Mumbai Police has booked a man for allegedly posing as the nephew of Maharashtra Energy Minister Nitin Raut and duping several job aspirants. The accused had cheated more than 10 people across Mumbai, Thane and Mira Bhayandar areas. He allegedly took money from victims on the pretext of providing them jobs in Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Ltd (MSEDCL).

163.title: Punjab Police arrests BJP's Bagga from Delhi home over alleged threat to Kejriwal
163.article_body: Punjab Police on Friday arrested BJP spokesperson Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga from his Delhi home, Aam Aadmi Party MLA Naresh Balyan tweeted. Bagga had allegedly threatened Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal over his remarks on 'The Kashmir Files'. "Bagga has been arrested by 50 police personnel of Punjab Police...he is a true Sikh...they cannot threaten him," BJP's Kapil Mishra said.

164.title: UP school principal asks students to dress up in Eid attire; booked
164.article_body: Bushra Mustafa, principal of a private school in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj, was booked for allegedly asking students to dress up in salwar kurta with Eid cap (boys) and salwar kurta with dupatta (girls) and record a video saying 'Happy Eid'. Mustafa told police that she did it to maintain equality, so students of all faiths know about each other's religions.

165.title: US limits use of J&J COVID-19 vaccine due to rare blood clot risk
165.article_body: US' Food and Drug Administration (FDA) said it's limiting the use of Johnson & Johnson's COVID-19 vaccine for adults due to the ongoing risk of rare but serious blood clots. The shot should only be given to people who cannot receive a different vaccine or specifically request J&J's vaccine, FDA said. Around 18.7 million Americans have received a J&J shot.

166.title: Expected Pant's captaincy to be way better, surprised by his moves: Jaffer
166.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said he expected DC captain Rishabh Pant's captaincy to be a lot better, adding that he has been surprised by some of Pant's decisions in IPL 2022 so far. "On the batting front as well, Pant has not lit up IPL 2022," stated Jaffer. "DC need him to contribute...to take them to the playoffs," said Jaffer.

167.title: 1st stretch of Bengaluru-Mysuru expressway to open in July: Mysuru MP
167.article_body: The first stretch of the Bengaluru-Mysuru Expressway will likely be opened for public use in July, Mysuru MP Pratap Simha said. "The 56-km stretch from Bengaluru-Nidaghatta will be launched in July and the following stretch from Nidaghatta-Mysuru will be completed by Dasara," Simha tweeted. Notably, the expressway is expected to reduce the travel time from 3 hours to 90 minutes.

168.title: No shortage of coal in India, govt ready if problem arises: MSME Minister
168.article_body: Minister of State for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) Bhanu Pratap Singh Verma said there is no shortage of coal in India. He added that if such a problem arises, the government is ready to deal with it. Notably, hundreds of passenger trains were cancelled last week for movement of coal carriages amid the apparent power crisis in India.

169.title: 6-yr-old girl raped in MP; accused's house bulldozed within 24 hrs
169.article_body: A six-year-old girl was allegedly raped by a shopkeeper in Madhya Pradesh's Morena after he lured her to a room behind the shop using chocolate and biscuits. Within 24 hours of the case being filed, the district administration bulldozed the accused's house in the presence of the Sub-Divisional Magistrate, an SHO said. The girl has been admitted to a hospital.

170.title: B'wood needs to be a part of MCU, bring in 1st Indian superhero: Benedict
170.article_body: 'Doctor Strange' actor Benedict Cumberbatch has suggested that Bollywood should also be a part of the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU). "Maybe have a massive dance and bring in the first Indian superhero," he added. "There are incredible Indian actors, whether they are born in the UK like obviously Sir Ben Kingsley or Dev Patel," Benedict further said.

171.title: PM Modi's 2017 Israel visit was 'goosebumps moment' for me: Jaishankar
171.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said that India and Israel have a truly special relationship and since PM Narendra Modi visited the country in 2017, the relationship has "really taken off". "For me the goosebumps moment in a way was at Tel Aviv when the PM visited Israel in July 2017, the first Indian PM to visit Israel," he added.

172.title: GOQii aims to help customers defeat diabetes, offers gold & more rewards
172.article_body: GOQii has announced #DefeatDiabetes, a national campaign where people can win gold and other rewards by reducing HbA1c levels by 1 percentage point in 6 months. The GOQii Diabetes Care program is backed by smart technology, personal coaching, doctor consultations and ISO certified health services on the GOQii app.

173.title: Don't patronise us: India's UN envoy to Dutch envoy on abstaining in UNGA on Ukraine
