173.article_body: India's UN Ambassador TS Tirumurti while replying to a tweet by the Ambassador of the Netherlands to the UK on India abstaining in the UN General Assembly on Ukraine, said, "Kindly don't patronise us. We know what to do." Meanwhile, the Dutch envoy had tweeted, "You should not have abstained in the GA. Respect the UN Charter."

174.title: India reports 3,545 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 19,688
174.article_body: India has reported 3,545 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,275 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 19,688, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,002, according to the latest data.

175.title: DC troll Umran Malik for giving away four runs off the fastest ball of IPL 2022
175.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) trolled SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) fast bowler Umran Malik for being hit for a four off the fastest delivery of IPL 2022. Umran bowled a 157-kmph delivery in DC's last over, with Rovman Powell scoring a boundary off it. "Came in at 157 kmph, went back at 200...A Powell welcome for Umran," DC tweeted.

176.title: Which players have hit the most sixes after 50 matches in IPL 2022?
176.article_body: After the conclusion of 50 matches in IPL 2022, RR opener Jos Buttler has hit the most number of sixes in the season so far, with 36 maximums. He is followed by PBKS' Liam Livingstone, who has smashed 23 sixes. KKR's Andre Russell has hit 22 sixes, while RR captain Sanju Samson has slammed 21 maximums.

177.title: Bodies of 3 youths found from Zanzari waterfall in Gujarat
177.article_body: The bodies of three Ahmedabad-based youths were retrieved from the Zanzari waterfall in Gujarat's Dabha by the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF). The deceased, all in their twenties, had arrived at the waterfall on Wednesday evening. "Around 7 pm, we received news of three young men drowning in the...waterfalls. Immediately local divers were contacted," officials said.

178.title: Israeli series Fauda's actor Tsahi sings 'Tere Jaisa Yaar' at embassy's event in Delhi
178.article_body: Israeli actor Tsahi Halevi, who gained fame after the series 'Fauda', sang 'Tere Jaisa Yaar' on the occasion of the 74th Independence Day of his country. Halevi sang it at an event organised by the Embassy of Israel in Delhi. The event also commemorated 30 years of diplomatic ties between India and Israel.

179.title: He'll want to do something special: Chawla on Hardik facing his ex-team MI
179.article_body: Cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla said GT captain Hardik Pandya will want to do "something special" against his former franchise MI. "It may be at the back of Hardik's mind that MI released him," added Chawla. Talking about GT opener Shubman Gill, Chawla stated that Gill needs to lift his game having played "only two" good knocks in IPL 2022 so far.

180.title: Putin apologised for Foreign Minister's 'Hitler had Jewish blood' remark: Israel
180.article_body: Israel's Prime Minister Naftali Bennett has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin apologised for remarks made by Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, who claimed Adolf Hitler had "Jewish blood". Lavrov made the remark to try to justify Russia's portrayal of Ukraine as "Nazi" despite the fact that its President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is Jewish.

181.title: Worried about Kohli's strike rate, various bowlers dismissing him: Bishop
181.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Ian Bishop said he is "concerned" about Virat Kohli's strike rate in IPL 2022, as well as the fact that different types of bowlers are dismissing him. "If you are not getting ahead of the run-rate...you need to bat deep into the innings. And Kohli isn't going deep into the innings either," added Bishop.

182.title: Russian troops have destroyed nearly 400 hospitals: Ukraine Prez
182.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that Russian troops have "destroyed or damaged" nearly 400 hospitals and other medical institutions. "This amounts to a complete lack of medication for cancer patients. It means extreme difficulties or a complete lack of insulin for diabetes. It's impossible to carry out surgery. It even means, quite simply, a lack of antibiotics," Zelenskyy added.

183.title: Tushar Giri Nath appointed as Bengaluru civic body's new head
183.article_body: Ahead of Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) elections, the Karnataka government on Thursday announced the transfer of the civic body's Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta and has appointed IAS officer Tushar Giri Nath as the new head. Nath was previously the Principal Secretary in the state's Revenue Department. Gupta was appointed as BBMP Chief Commissioner last year.

184.title: Man dies after setting himself, friend on fire in northeast Delhi
184.article_body: A 38-year-old man died after setting himself on fire while his woman friend (38) has sustained serious injuries in northeast Delhi's Mandoli area. The two were allegedly in a relationship despite being married to other people, police said. Notably, the incident, which seems like a crime of passion, happened after the duo had an altercation over a mangalsutra, police said.

185.title: Alibaba briefly loses $26 bn in market value after a man surnamed 'Ma' is held
185.article_body: The arrest of a man surnamed 'Ma' in China led to shares of Jack Ma's Alibaba falling by almost 10% within minutes on May 3, briefly erasing about $26 billion of market value. The Chinese state-run media had reported that the man was arrested for alleged national security violations. After the media issued a clarification, Alibaba's shares recovered their losses.

186.title: Pune's rural areas record higher COVID vaccination rates than urban areas
186.article_body: Over the last few days, the COVID-19 vaccination rates in the Pune district have been recorded higher in the district's rural areas than those in the urban areas, said the data of the CoWin app. Notably, over 11,741 jabs were given on May 4 in Pune's rural areas while 5,632 jabs were given in the district's urban areas.

187.title: Over 10 lakh people visit Mumbai's Haji Ali Dargah in two days during Eid
187.article_body: The number of visitors at Mumbai's Haji Ali Dargah crossed 10-lakh mark on Eid and the day after it, which earlier used to be around two to three lakh. "This year we were taken aback with the huge response of the crowd, it crossed nearly a million...because of the two-year gap due to lockdown," Managing Trustee of the dargah said.

188.title: 40-year-old man who 'forcibly undressed' 2 girls in Delhi school detained
188.article_body: Delhi Police detained a 40-year-old man in connection with the molestation of girl students in a civic body-run school in the Northeast district. The man had allegedly sexually assaulted two girls, forcibly taken off their clothes and urinated in front of an entire class. "We spoke to the girls...based on their description, a sketch was made," police said.

189.title: 4,500 fined ₹22 lakh in 12 days for not wearing masks in Delhi
189.article_body: More than 4,500 people were fined over ₹22 lakh between April 23 and May 4 for not wearing masks in Delhi amid COVID-19 pandemic, according to government data. The maximum number of fines were imposed in East district on 1,133 people followed by New Delhi at 705. "We are averaging around 100 challans per day," a Southeast district official said.

190.title: Ridership increases in Mumbai's AC local trains on Day 1 of lower fares
190.article_body: The Western Railway (WR) witnessed a 30% increase in ridership on its air-conditioned (AC) coaches on Thursday, which was the first day of the Railways' implementation of revised single-journey ticket fares for passengers. Over 5,360 people boarded AC local trains till 5 pm on Thursday. The price of tickets for AC locals is reduced by over 50% on single journeys.

191.title: Musk's $44-billion Twitter deal under review by US FTC: Report
191.article_body: The US FTC is reviewing Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $44 billion Twitter deal, Bloomberg News reported. The FTC will decide in June if it will do an in-depth antitrust probe of the proposed transaction. Musk's initial purchase of a 9% Twitter stake is already under an FTC probe to see if he complied with an antitrust reporting requirement.

192.title: Over 550 kg drugs worth ₹42 cr seized this year in Mumbai: Police
192.article_body: The Mumbai Police have seized 550 kilograms of drugs from January to March this year and have arrested 2,897 persons for being allegedly involved in drug cases in the city. The total value of the seized contraband stands at ₹42.25 crore. According to data provided by the police, ganja has been the most seized contraband in the city.

193.title: 3 killed in stabbing attack in Israel on Independence Day
193.article_body: At least three people were killed in a stabbing attack in Israel's Elad as the country marked its Independence Day on Thursday. Police said they suspect it was a terrorist attack and that the militants escaped in a vehicle. Condemning the "murderous attack", Israel's Foreign Minister Yair Lapid said, "The joy of Independence Day had been interrupted in an instant."

194.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read with 20 matches remaining?
194.article_body: With 20 matches left in the league stage, GT are on top of the IPL 2022 points table. GT have won eight out of their 10 matches so far. LSG, who have won three matches in a row, are second. CSK are placed ninth on the table, while five-time champions MI are last. Meanwhile, RR are third on the table.

195.title: Delhi Police apprehends 13-year-old boy for drowning baby in water tank
195.article_body: Delhi Police apprehended a 13-year-old boy for allegedly killing an eight-month-old baby by drowning him in a rooftop water tank of his house in Delhi's Dallupura. The accused had a grudge against the mother of the infant, police said. The juvenile had an impression that the deceased's mother had complained about him to his mother, police added.

196.title: Karine to be 1st black and 1st openly LGBTQ+ person to serve as WH Press Secy
196.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Thursday named Karine Jean-Pierre as the next White House Press Secretary. Jean-Pierre will replace Jen Psaki, under whom she served as deputy, from May 13. "She will be the first black and the first openly LGBTQ+ person to serve as the White House Press Secretary," Psaki tweeted after the announcement.

197.title: Pune rly police arrest 2 for call seeking ₹7cr for bomb threat info
197.article_body: Pune railway police have arrested two men for making a hoax bomb threat call to the railway authorities. A man had demanded ₹7 crore for information about the bomb's location during the call, which was made on Tuesday around 4pm. The railway police said that there was a "huge police presence" at the station which caused "fear among the civilians".

198.title: Woman police official arrests own fiancé on charges of fraud in Assam
198.article_body: A woman police official of the Assam Police lodged an FIR and arrested her own fiancé on charges of fraud. The accused, who posed as an ONGC employee, allegedly asked people for money on the pretext of giving them a job with the company. The couple got engaged in October last year and were set to get married in November.

199.title: Virus found in pig heart transplanted into man in US
199.article_body: While trying to learn what killed the first person to receive a heart transplant from a pig, researchers discovered the organ harboured an animal virus, called porcine cytomegalovirus. However researchers did not say if the virus played any role in the man's death. David Bennett Sr, from US' Maryland, died in March, two months after the groundbreaking experimental transplant.

200.title: Schools can't force parents to buy costly books, uniforms: Delhi govt
200.article_body: Private schools cannot force parents to buy expensive books and uniforms from a specific vendor, an order by Delhi's Directorate of Education said. Schools must display information of at least five shops where its books and uniforms shall be made available and class-wise list of books in upcoming session must be communicated to parents well in advance, the order stated.

201.title: Warner smashes 92*(58) as DC hand SRH their 3rd defeat in a row in IPL 2022
201.article_body: DC defeated SRH by 21 runs on Thursday to jump to the fifth position on the IPL 2022 points table. DC opener David Warner smashed 92*(58) against his former team as DC put up a total of 207/3. SRH were restricted to 186/8 as Khaleel Ahmed took three wickets against his former team. SRH have now lost three straight matches.

202.title: AR Rahman's daughter Khatija gets married, singer shares pic
202.article_body: Singer-composer AR Rahman's daughter Khatija Rahman got married to Riyasdeen Shaik Mohamed. "May the Almighty bless the couple...thanking you in advance for your good wishes and love," the singer wrote while sharing a picture from the ceremony on Instagram. Riyasdeen is an audio engineer and aspiring entrepreneur. The couple got engaged in December 2021.

203.title: It has been so long, I don't care: Zaheer on rumours of dating Sonakshi
203.article_body: Actor Zaheer Iqbal, reacting to dating rumours with Sonakshi Sinha, has said, "Now it has been so long, I don't even care." "I am like okay if you think, then you think. Keep thinking. It's good for you," he added. Zaheer further revealed that actor Salman Khan had advised him not to pay too attention to such things.

204.title: Tesla asks India team to work for APAC amid high import duty: Report
204.article_body: US-based electric carmaker Tesla has reportedly asked its Indian team to start working for the Asia-Pacific market as import duties here remain high despite Tesla working for a tax break since 2019. Most employees have travelled to Dubai and are working for the Middle East markets, ET reported. Currently, India charges a 100% import duty on EVs worth over $40,000.

205.title: Was a sudden attack of diarrhoea: Mumtaz on being hospitalised
205.article_body: Veteran actress Mumtaz, who was admitted to the hospital because of a severe stomach infection, has said that she suffers from Irritable Bowel Syndrome and Colitis. "It was a sudden attack of diarrhoea which didn't stop despite the best of medication. Hence, hospitalisation was required," she stated. Mumtaz added, "In the hospital too, it took me seven days to normalise."

206.title: Jail officials neglected my wife Navneet's health issues: MLA Ravi
206.article_body: Maharashtra MLA Ravi Rana said that officials of Byculla women's jail in Mumbai neglected his MP wife Navneet Rana's health issues even after she requested hospitalisation. The duo was arrested on April 23 after they threatened to chant the Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray's residence. They were granted bail by a Mumbai sessions court on Wednesday.

207.title: UP CM inaugurates ₹43-crore guest house for tourists in Haridwar
207.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath inaugurated a guest house for tourists in Uttarakhand's Haridwar along with the state CM Pushkar Singh Dhami. The guest house, which is said to be worth ₹43.27 crore, has 100 rooms and was built by the Uttar Pradesh government. "Uttarakhand has ample opportunities for eco-tourism along with spiritual tourism," Yogi Adityanath said.

208.title: Audio of Johnny Depp 'howling like an animal' while he was intoxicated played in court
208.article_body: An audio of Johnny Depp "howling like an animal" while he was intoxicated on a private flight from Boston to Los Angeles in 2014 was played in court during the ongoing defamation trial. His ex-wife, actress Amber Heard said she recorded it because he wouldn't remember how bad it was afterwards. Heard further said he reeked of "weed and alcohol".

209.title: David Warner records most fifties in T20 cricket, breaks Chris Gayle's record
209.article_body: DC opener David Warner on Thursday smashed his 89th fifty in T20 cricket, scoring 92*(58) against SRH in their IPL 2022 clash. With this, Warner set the record for scoring the most number of fifties in T20 cricket, overtaking Chris Gayle (88). Apart from 89 fifties, Warner has also hit eight T20 hundreds. Meanwhile, Gayle has slammed 22 T20 hundreds.

210.title: Which investors are giving Musk over $7 billion in new financing to buy Twitter?
210.article_body: Elon Musk has secured a new financing commitment of $7.139 billion for his $44 billion Twitter buyout. Investors include Binance, Oracle Co-founder Larry Ellison, Brookfield, Fidelity, Qatar Holding, Sequoia Capital Fund, Aliya Capital, Honeycomb & Vy Capital among others. Saudi Prince Alwaleed bin Talal, who initially opposed the buyout, has agreed to roll his $1.89 billion stake into the deal.

211.title: What is Shigella, the bacteria that killed a girl after she ate shawarma in Kerala?
211.article_body: Shigella bacteria was the cause for the food poisoning incident in Kerala, which claimed the life of a 16-year-old girl, who consumed chicken shawarma from an eatery. It causes an infection called shigellosis. Most people with Shigella infection have diarrhea (sometimes bloody), fever and stomach cramps.  People with severe illness and those with underlying conditions should be given antibiotics.

212.title: Bitcoin drops 8.4% to $36,639 in biggest drop in almost a month
212.article_body: World's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin registered the biggest drop in almost a month on Thursday. It fell as much as 8.4% to $36,639 today after gaining 5.3% on Wednesday, which is the biggest intraday drop since April 11. Meanwhile, altcoins Ethereum, Avalanche and Solana were also down by 7.2%, 11% and 7.3% respectively.

213.title: Rajasthan Technical University VC caught taking bribe of ₹5 lakh
213.article_body: Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) officials said Rajasthan Technical University Vice Chancellor RA Gupta was caught taking a bribe of ₹5 lakh at a government guest house in Jaipur. He reportedly demanded the money for increasing the number of engineering seats at a private university. An ACB official said that ₹21 lakh cash was recovered from his room.

214.title: 25,000 houses in Delhi to get free sewer connections: Govt
214.article_body: Delhi Jal Board has announced that 25,000 households in East Delhi will be provided free sewer connections under 'Mukhyamantri Muft Sewer Connection Yojana'. An amount of ₹19 crore has been allocated for this and the connection will be provided in 12 colonies in Karawal Nagar and Mustafabad. The decision was taken at a meeting chaired by board Chairman Satyendar Jain.

215.title: Singhdeo files complaint against BJP's Kapil Mishra for defaming Rahul Gandhi
215.article_body: Chhattisgarh Minister TS Singhdeo on Thursday filed a police complaint against BJP leaders Kapil Mishra and Harish Khurana, and retired Major Surendra Poonia for defaming Congress leader Rahul Gandhi through their tweets. Social media posts by Mishra, Khurana and Poonia saying Gandhi had a secret meeting with the Chinese Ambassador to Nepal are "utterly false and malicious", the complaint read.

216.title: Shah should focus on incidents in Delhi, UP instead of WB: Mamata
216.article_body: Reacting to Home Minister Amit Shah's comments on TMC, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that he should concentrate on what happened in Delhi's Jahangirpuri and Uttar Pradesh instead of West Bengal. "Don't do things to bulldoze the democratic structure of the country," she said. Amit Shah had accused TMC of spreading rumours that the CAA will not be implemented.

217.title: K'taka Police recruitment scam: Dy SP, Inspector, 5 constables held
217.article_body: A Deputy Superintendent of Police, Inspector and five constables were arrested on Thursday for their alleged role in the malpractices during the October 2021 examination for recruiting 545 Sub-Inspectors. The allegation is that the mentioned police officers did not report malpractices at the centres they were in charge of during the exam.

218.title: Edtech unicorn Vedantu lays off 200 employees
218.article_body: Edtech unicorn Vedantu has laid off 120 contract-based and 80 full-time employees constituting 3.5% of Vedantu's 6,000-people workforce. "Academics or assistant teachers were being reevaluated. We have an annual contract, and at the beginning of every academic year, we follow a process of load rebalancing," Vedantu said. Recently, edtech startups Unacademy and Lido also announced layoffs.

219.title: 5 bodies recovered from river Ganga in Bihar's Buxar
219.article_body: Officials said that five bodies were recovered from river Ganga in Bihar's Buxar district, adding four bodies were of males while the fifth body was that of a woman. "It seems family members of all the deceased may have thrown the bodies in the river after they were handed to them after autopsy," Buxar SDO Dhirendra Kumar Mishra said.

220.title: TVS elevates Sudarshan Venu as Managing Director
220.article_body: Sudarshan Venu, son of Venu Srinivasan, on Thursday took over as the Managing Director of TVS Motor Company. Sudarshan was earlier the joint MD of the firm. Accepting his new role, Sudarshan said, "With the continued guidance of my father and Sir Ralf (TVS Chairman) and the support of the board...I look forward to further embracing the future of mobility."

221.title: Lost sense of smell due to brain haemorrhage after domestic abuse: Poonam
221.article_body: Actress Poonam Pandey has revealed that she has lost her sense of smell completely after the domestic violence she suffered at the hands of her ex-husband Sam Bombay. "When the domestic violence happened to me, I lost the sense of smell completely. With brain haemorrhage, it is connected," she stated. "I ask people around me about the smell," Poonam added.

222.title: Thousands face breathing issues due to severe dust storms in Iraq: Report
222.article_body: More than 3,000 people faced breathing problems and sought medical help after a dust storm hit Iraq's capital Baghdad on Thursday, medical officials said. According to a report, one person has died due to the same in Baghdad. Iraq has reportedly seen an increasing number of dust, sand and windstorms in recent years, including several in recent weeks.

223.title: Joke isn't on your son: Kamra to man over edited video of his son who sang for PM
223.article_body: Stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra responded after a man criticised him for posting edited video of his son who sang for PM Narendra Modi in Germany. "The joke isn't on your son. While you enjoy your son sing for his motherland to the most popular son, there are songs he should listen to from people of his country also," Kamra tweeted.

224.title: Prashant Kishor is a political businessman: Bihar BJP leader
224.article_body: Former BJP MP and senior BJP leader from Bihar Hukumdev Narayan Yadav called Prashant Kishor a political businessman. "Don't call Prashant Kishor a strategist, he is a political businessman and it is not right for people to discuss businessmen in such an important way," Yadav said. His comment comes after Kishor announced a 3,000 km Padyatra from October 2.

225.title: NATO will increase presence in Baltic sea if Sweden applies: Stoltenberg
225.article_body: NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg has said that bloc will strengthen its presence around Sweden's borders and Baltic sea if the country applies to join NATO. He added that bloc will have "very strong obligation" to guarantee the country's security amid potential membership bid. Stoltenberg's remarks come amid reports that Sweden and Finland will formally apply to join NATO in May.

226.title: Delhi will become the startup destination of the world: Kejriwal
226.article_body: After the Delhi Cabinet approved a start-up policy, CM Arvind Kejriwal said that Delhi will become the startup destination of the world. The start-up policy approved by the Cabinet seeks to provide youth with financial assistance to set up companies. "Creating entrepreneurs and business leaders out of our youth is a subject very close to my heart," he said.

227.title: Impartial probe into K'taka PSI scam has begun: Basavaraj Bommai
227.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that an impartial probe in the alleged police sub-inspector (PSI) recruitment scam has begun. He assured all those involved will be booked and brought to justice. "We have arrested more than 20 people in the PSI scam," Bommai said. All complaints, details and documents related to the PSI scam will be considered, he added.

228.title: BJP won't return to power in 2024, CAA won't be implemented: Mamata
228.article_body: Responding to BJP leader Amit Shah's claim that CAA will be implemented when COVID-19 subsides, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that BJP won't return to power in 2024 and CAA won't be implemented. "The CAA bill has lapsed. Why are they not bringing this bill to Parliament? I don't want the rights of citizens to be curbed," she said.

229.title: Take all steps to avoid deaths due to heatwave: PM Modi to officials
229.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday chaired a high-level meeting to review preparations for heatwave and monsoon season. He asked officials to take all measures to avoid loss of life due to heatwave or fire incidents. "Holistic efforts needed to reduce the vulnerability of forests in the country against fire hazards," PM Modi added.

230.title: US stocks fall after Federal Reserve raises interest rates by 50 bps
230.article_body: US stocks fell after the Federal Reserve raised interest rates by 50 bps on Wednesday, citing elevated inflation. While Nasdaq Composite fell 546.15 points to 12,418.70 and registered a 4.21% drop, S&P 500 fell 130.19 points to 4,169.98 and registered a 3.03% drop in the early hours of trading. Dow Jones Industrial Average also fell 2.58% to touch 33,182.33 points.

231.title: Madhavan's Rocketry: The Nambi Effect to premiere at Cannes on May 19
231.article_body: R Madhavan's 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' will be premiering at the Cannes Film Festival on May 19. Taking to Instagram, Madhavan wrote, "Did not imagine this when we began this journey." The film is based on aerospace engineer Nambi Narayanan. Actor Shah Rukh Khan will have a cameo in the Hindi and English versions of the film.

232.title: Will probe Imran Khan's 'foreign conspiracy' claim: Pakistan minister
232.article_body: Pakistan minister Marriyum Aurangzeb said on Thursday that government will form a commission to probe ex-PM Imran Khan's claim that 'foreign conspiracy' allegedly led to his ouster. Aurangzeb said the commission will be unbiased and headed by a person "no one will be able to point fingers at". Imran Khan was ousted through no-trust vote in parliament on April 10.

233.title: Old pics show Johnny Depp allegedly passed out after using drugs
233.article_body: Jury was shown images of Johnny Depp allegedly passed out after using drugs, as ex-wife Amber Heard continued her testimony. Court was shown a picture of Depp appearing to be asleep, which Heard said was taken in the Bahamas and came after a "stint of sobriety". Another picture shows Depp slumped forward. Heard said he was "on a drugs binge".

234.title: Child rights body seeks action against Kamra over edited video of boy who sang for PM
234.article_body: National Commission for Protection of Child Rights wrote to Twitter and Delhi Police, seeking action against stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra for posting edited video of a boy who sang for PM Narendra Modi in Germany. NCPCR sought removal of the video. The boy's father had threatened Kamra with legal action, saying, "Keep the poor boy out of your filthy politics."

235.title: Alia Bhatt to appear on Koffee with Karan with Ranveer Singh: Report
235.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt and actor Ranveer Singh will reportedly feature in the first episode of Karan Johar's show 'Koffee with Karan'. According to a report by Pinkvilla, Alia and Ranveer will be shooting for this episode around May 10. Earlier, it was reported that Alia will come to the show along with her husband and actor Ranbir Kapoor.

236.title: Will decide on Moldova's request to join EU by June-end: Official
236.article_body: European Union (EU) will decide on Moldova's request to join the bloc by end of June, an official confirmed on Thursday. The announcement comes after the EU pledged more military support for the country amid the ongoing Russian invasion of Ukraine. Notably, Moldova is a former Soviet republic and had formally applied to join the bloc in March.

237.title: Govt asks VPN providers to store user data for 5 years or face up to 1 year in jail
237.article_body: The government's CERT-In requires VPN service providers to collect and hold user data for five years or longer under new rules applicable from June-end. Non-compliance may invite punitive action under subsection (7) of section 70B of the IT Act, 2000. Non-compliance may lead to up to one year of imprisonment or a fine of up to ₹1 lakh, or both.

238.title: You've given me my family back: Shark Tank contestant to Ashneer in a letter
238.article_body: Rakhi Pal, the Co-founder of student community startup EventBeep which received investments from Ashneer Grover, Aman Gupta and Peyush Bansal on Shark Tank India, thanked Ashneer in a letter. "You've given me my family back and their trust in this vision," Rakhi wrote to Ashneer. During the show, Rakhi had said that her family disowned her over her startup work.

239.title: EU regulator warns of potential risk to civil planes amid Ukraine war
239.article_body: European Union's Aviation Safety Agency (EASA) warned on Thursday that there's an increased risk of civil planes being accidentally targetted in Ukraine war. "Misidentification is easy in confused arenas of warfare. The development of this risk is common to all combatants," the regulator said. EASA added that there were also risks related to increase in military operations using civilian airports.

240.title: Oil crosses $110 mark after EU plans phased ban on Russian oil
240.article_body: Oil price on Thursday crossed the $110 mark after the European Union laid out plans to place a phased ban on all Russian oil imports. Brent crude rose 1.4% to $111.73/barrel while US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) rose 1.2% to $109.11/barrel. "Today, we'll propose...a complete import ban on all Russian oil," EU chief Ursula von der Leyen said on Wednesday.

241.title: BJP won't rest till it uproots Mamata's TMC from Bengal: Amit Shah
241.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said that the BJP will not rest till it ends CM Mamata Banerjee's Trinamool Congress' rule from West Bengal. "Bengal is the only Indian state where the price of petrol is ₹115 per litre. In BJP-ruled states, the price is ₹105. The Bengal government charges 25% VAT besides local state tax," Shah said.

242.title: Japan to freeze assets of 140 more Russian individuals: PM Kishida
242.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida on Thursday said that the country would freeze the assets of 140 more Russian individuals over its invasion of Ukraine. He said that an export ban will be expanded to Russian military firms. Kishida said it's time for the G7 to solidify its unity, adding that it must be shown that there're consequences to Russia's violence.

243.title: Karnal terror suspects could just be explosive transporters: Khattar
243.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Thursday said that it's not clear if the four terror suspects detained in Karnal are terrorists or pawns of the terror organisations being used to transport explosives. Karnal SP Ganga Ram Punia said that the accused were caught with a desi pistol, 31 live ammunition, three iron containers with explosives and around ₹1.3 lakh.

244.title: Maha MP Navneet Rana cries as husband visits her in hospital 12 days after arrest
244.article_body: Maharashtra MP Navneet Rana broke down in tears on meeting her MLA husband Ravi Rana at Lilavati Hospital in Mumbai on Thursday. Navneet was released from the Byculla jail and her husband was released from Taloja jail 12 days after they were arrested over the Hanuman Chalisa issue. Navneet has been admitted to Lilavati Hospital due to health issues.

245.title: WHO claims India had 47 lakh Covid deaths, 10 times more than estimate; govt objects
245.article_body: A WHO report has estimated that there were 47 lakh Covid-19 deaths in India from January 2020 till December 2021 end, which is nearly 10 times the official figures. India rejected the estimates by calling data collection methodology "questionable" and said, "Despite India's objection to the process, methodology and outcome of this modelling exercise, WHO released the excess mortality estimates."

246.title: Umran Malik bowls the fastest delivery of IPL 2022, breaks own record
246.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) fast bowler Umran Malik on Thursday bowled the fastest delivery of IPL 2022 so far after clocking 154.8 kmph against Delhi Capitals (DC) opener David Warner on Thursday. The 22-year-old broke his own record of 154 kmph. He had clocked 154 kmph twice in SRH's match against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) on May 1.

247.title: ISRO planning to launch mission to Venus in December 2024
247.article_body: Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) is readying a spacecraft to orbit Venus, the solar system's hottest planet. Addressing a day-long meeting, ISRO Chairman S Somanath said the Venus mission has been conceived, a project report made and "money identified". ISRO is eyeing the December 2024 window for its launch with orbital maneuvers planned for the following year.

248.title: Nushrratt gets vulgar comments for playing condom salesgirl, shares video
248.article_body: Nushrratt Bharuccha shared vulgar comments she received on social media for playing a condom salesgirl in her upcoming film 'Janhit Mein Jaari'. In the video shared on Instagram, Nushrratt said, "This is the thinking we need to change." She shared the comments in the video. A user on Facebook commented, "Madam that thing is not for the jeans."

249.title: Gucci to start accepting crypto payments in some US stores
249.article_body: Italian fashion company Gucci has announced that customers can pay with crypto at some of its flagship stores in the US starting later this month. The company will accept various digital currencies including bitcoin, ethereum, dogecoin, shiba inu, litecoin and a few US dollar-pegged stablecoins. The service will be expanded to its directly operated North America stores soon.

250.title: Ola Cars CEO Arun Sirdeshmukh resigns less than a year after launch
250.article_body: Ola Cars CEO Arun Sirdeshmukh has resigned less than a year after the vehicle sales business was launched, an Ola spokesperson told the Economic Times. Sirdeshmukh's roles as Ola Cars CEO and the Go-to-Market head of Ola Electric will now be under Group Ola CFO Arun Kumar GR, the spokesperson said. This comes amid concerns over quality of Ola e-scooters.

251.title: US condemns attack at Karachi University that killed 4 people
251.article_body: The US has condemned the suicide attack that occurred inside the premises of the University of Karachi in Pakistan and killed four people. US State Department Spokesperson Ned Price said, "A terrorist attack anywhere is an affront to humanity everywhere." "But for a terrorist attack to take place at...university...we've seen recently, that is a true affront to mankind," Price added.

252.title: Ukrainian Prez launches crowdfunding platform to win war with Russia
252.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has launched a global crowdfunding platform to help the country win its war with Russia. Zelenskyy said, "[You] can donate funds to...save our civilians...to rebuild Ukraine." He said that all funds will be transferred to Ukraine's national bank, adding that the government would give an update "every 24 hours" about how the money was being used.

253.title: TN announces free travel for children below 5 yrs in govt buses
253.article_body: Tamil Nadu government said on Thursday that children aged less than 5 years will be exempted from paying fares in buses operated by government-run transport bodies. Transport Minister SS Sivasankar, who made announcement, added that automated travel ticket system, redressal body for passengers will be set up. Currently, children aged between 3 and 12 years need to pay 'half fare'.

254.title: Omar Abdullah mistakenly announces party MP's death, apologises later
254.article_body: National Conference leader Omar Abdullah on Thursday apologised for mistakenly announcing the death of party MP Akbar Lone. Abdullah had earlier announced that Lone died after a brief illness in Srinagar. "Lone is admitted to SKIMS for respiratory infection and is responding well to the treatment," the hospital also issued a statement.

255.title: 'KGF: Chapter 2' becomes 2nd-highest earning film in Hindi ever
255.article_body: 'KGF: Chapter 2' has surpassed the lifetime business of the film 'Dangal' and is now the second-highest grossing film in Hindi ever. "Glorious march towards ₹400 crore begins," tweeted film trade analyst Taran Adarsh. The top three highest grossing films in Hindi are 'Baahubali 2', 'KGF 2' and 'Dangal'. 'KGF 2' has earned over ₹1,000 crore worldwide.

256.title: Insurgent groups are involved in poppy cultivation: Manipur CM
256.article_body: Manipur CM N Biren Singh said that some insurgent groups of Manipur were involved in poppy cultivation and drug smuggling from Myanmar border. Insurgency problems in Manipur and North-eastern regions had reduced upto 75%, he said. "My immediate need is to rehabilitate poppy planters for their livelihood," he added. He raised the issue during his interaction with the central government.

257.title: 70-year-old mentally challenged woman raped in UP, accused arrested
257.article_body: A 70-year-old mentally challenged woman was allegedly abducted and raped in a village in Uttar Pradesh's Mirzapur, following which the accused was arrested, police said on Thursday. She was abducted and taken to a secluded place by a man on Tuesday where he allegedly raped her, Additional Superintendent of Police (rural) Sanjeev Bajpai said.

258.title: Musk expected to be temporary Twitter CEO after buyout deal: Report
258.article_body: Elon Musk is expected to serve as Twitter's temporary CEO for a few months after he completes Twitter's $44 billion buyout, CNBC reported. Parag Agrawal is Twitter's current CEO after taking over the role from Co-founder Jack Dorsey in November 2021. A few days ago, Agrawal responded, "Nope! we're still here," to a Twitter user who thought Agrawal was fired.

259.title: Hindu man killed by his Muslim wife's family in Hyd; act caught on camera
259.article_body: A 25-year-old Hindu man, B Nagaraju, was attacked with rods and beaten to death by family of his Muslim wife Syed Ashrin Sulthana in Hyderabad, according to Sulthana's statement. "They killed my husband in the middle of the street. Five people attacked. My brother and others...killed him in front of my eyes," Sulthana said. The incident's video has also surfaced.

260.title: Facebook took action against 2.16 cr content pieces in India in March
260.article_body: Facebook 'actioned' against 2.16 crore pieces of content on the platform between March 1-31, Meta's compliance report released for March under the new IT Rules revealed. Of these content, 1.49 crore pieces were spam, followed by violent and graphic content at 25 lakh pieces. Facebook responded to all 656 reports it received through the Indian grievance mechanism, the report added.

261.title: Delimitation Commission will disempower J&K, extension of BJP: Mufti
261.article_body: After the Delimitation Commission submitted its final report on Thursday and recommended increasing the number of Assembly seats in Jammu and Kashmir, former CM Mehbooba Mufti called it an extension of the BJP. She added that the move is part of measures to disempower the people of the UT. J&K will now have 90 Assembly seats.

262.title: Actor Ajay Devgn reacts to rumours on fight with Shah Rukh Khan
262.article_body: Reacting to rumours of a fight with Shah Rukh Khan, actor Ajay Devgn has said, "The six-seven of us, who were from the 90's generation who started...together...we share a great rapport." "We speak over the phone, we're all fine," Ajay stated. The duo have never shared the screen in a film, however, have come together for a pan masala ad.

263.title: 'Rahul ji, are you ready for white challenge' posters seen in Hyd ahead of visit
263.article_body: Ahead of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's visit to Telangana, posters have surfaced challenging him for a 'white challenge'. The 'white challenge' was started against the drug menace by Congress MP Revanth Reddy in September 2021. The posters, which have pictures from Gandhi's recent visit to a nightclub in Nepal, read, "Rahul ji, are you ready for a white challenge?"

264.title: Amit Shah inaugurates 3 floating border posts on India-Bangladesh border
264.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday inaugurated three floating border posts on India-Bangladesh border, stating that Centre's prime goal is to enhance India's internal and external security. Shah inaugurated Narmada, Sutlej and Kaveri floating border posts to protect the inaccessible areas of Sundarbans. "The front part of these [posts] is...bulletproof for...safety of our jawans," he added.

265.title: SRH to bowl first against DC; DC make 4 changes, 3 players debut for SRH
265.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson won the toss and elected to bowl first against DC in their IPL 2022 match on Thursday. DC have made four changes to their playing XI, with Mandeep Singh, Ripal Patel, Khaleel Ahmed and Anrich Nortje being included in the side. Meanwhile, Shreyas Gopal, Sean Abbott and Kartik Tyagi are debuting for SRH.

266.title: Delhi Startup Policy launched to provide financial, procedural help
266.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday announced the launch of Delhi Startup Policy, which aims to provide young entrepreneurs with financial and procedural help. "The government will provide collateral-free loan, financial parts of rent and employee salaries," Kejriwal said. He added that the government will form a panel of CAs and lawyers where entrepreneurs can seek help for free.

267.title: Armed men attack Christian school in Pakistan, demand extortion money
267.article_body: Fourteen armed men attacked a Christian school in Pakistan's Punjab province and demanded extortion money from the school's principal, according to a report. The principal said that the attackers hurled chairs at the children while they were praying and damaged vehicles of the staff, the report added. They also allegedly issued death threats and misbehaved with the school's female staff.

268.title: Hindu man killed by his Muslim wife's family in Hyd; act caught on camera
268.article_body: A 25-year-old Hindu man, B Nagaraju, was allegedly attacked with rods and beaten to death by the family of his Muslim wife Syed Ashrin Sulthana in Hyderabad, according to Sulthana's statement. A video of the attack has surfaced online, showing the man bleeding on a busy road. "They got married recently...Brothers of the deceased's wife assaulted Nagaraju," a policeman said.

269.title: Ukraine war has dragged on, doing everything to stop it: Belarus Prez
269.article_body: Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko has said that he didn't expect Ukraine war to "drag on this way", adding that he's doing everything he can to stop it. Lukashenko stated that using nuclear weapons in Ukraine is "unacceptable" because of the country's proximity to Belarus. Notably, his comments come amid Russia's recent simulated nuclear-capable missile strikes in its enclave of Kaliningrad.

270.title: Chief of B'luru-based ATREE elected to US' National Academy of Sciences
270.article_body: The chief of Bengaluru-based Ashoka Trust for Research in Ecology and the Environment (ATREE), Dr Kamal Bawa, has been elected to the US' National Academy of Sciences, according to a statement by ATREE. Dr Bawa said, "The election is...reaffirmation of our important work on the ecology, conservation and management of tropical forests that are declining...but are critical to humanity's well-being."

271.title: B'luru man kills 30-yr-old wife after celebrating his birthday, held
271.article_body: A 35-year-old man has been detained in Bengaluru on charges of allegedly killing his 30-year-old wife by strangling her to death. The accused allegedly killed his wife after she confronted him about his extra-marital affair. Doctors who checked the victim at the hospital suspected foul play after he told them she fell unconscious due to low blood pressure, reports said.

272.title: Andhra man accused of chain-snatching kills self in police custody
272.article_body: A suspect in a chain-snatching case, identified as Manipalli Appa Rao, allegedly died by suicide in police custody in Andhra Pradesh's Eluru. Police said that the man was arrested on May 1 and the incident took place when the accused went to take a bath. He was rushed to a hospital, but died during treatment, SP Rahul Dev Sharma said.

273.title: Johnny Depp forced Amber Heard to give him oral sex when he was angry: Psychologist
273.article_body: A clinical psychologist who testified at Johnny Depp's trial against Amber Heard said Depp forced Heard into oral sex when he was angry. "When Depp was drunk or high, he'd throw her on...bed, rip off her nightgown, and try to have sex with her," the psychologist, Dawn Hughes, testified. "These weren't in loving moments. These were angry moments," she said.

274.title: Hindu man allegedly killed by his Muslim wife's family in Hyd; act caught on camera
274.article_body: A 25-year-old Hindu man, B Nagaraju, was allegedly attacked with rods and beaten to death by the family of his Muslim wife Syed Ashrin Sulthana in Hyderabad, police said. A video of the attack has surfaced online, showing the man bleeding on a busy road. "They got married recently...Brothers of the deceased's wife assaulted Nagaraju," a police officer said.

275.title: Remove encroachment from Okhla within 2 weeks: HC to authorities
275.article_body: Delhi HC on Thursday directed authorities to take action for the removal of encroachment from Okhla Industrial Area within two weeks. It also directed Delhi Police to ensure sufficient force is provided to the concerned authorities. South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) and Delhi State Industrial and Infrastructure Development Corporation Limited will chalk out plan to remove the encroachment.

276.title: Delhi Police find no CCTV at MCD school where 2 girls were molested
276.article_body: Delhi Police didn't find any CCTVs installed inside the school where two girl students were allegedly molested by an unknown person inside their classroom in an MCD school. Based on the statements of the girls, a portrait of the accused has been sketched and two suspects have been zeroed in, police added.

277.title: India's biggest-ever IPO of LIC gets fully subscribed
277.article_body: LIC's IPO, India's biggest ever, was fully subscribed on the second day of bidding on Thursday.   The ₹20,557-crore IPO, with price band fixed at ₹902-949 per share, received bids for 16.24 crore equity shares against the offer size of 16.2 crore shares. The policyholder portion was subscribed 3.02 times, employee portion 2.14 times, and retail investors subscribed 91%.

278.title: Why is LIC  being sold at a throwaway price?: Rahul Gandhi on LIC IPO
278.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi accused the PM Narendra Modi-led government of "undervaluing" LIC, and questioned, "Why is one of India's most valuable assets being sold at a throwaway price?" India's largest-ever IPO of LIC, where the government is selling its 3.5% stake, expects to raise ₹20,557 crore. The LIC issue was fully subscribed on Thursday, the second day of bidding.

279.title: Delhi-Meerut RRTS train set ready, to be handed over on May 7
279.article_body: The first train set of the Delhi-Meerut Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS) is ready and will be handed over to the National Capital Region Transport Corporation (NCRTC) on May 7. RRTS' train sets will be brought to Ghaziabad's Duhai depot. NCRTC said the train sets' manufacturing facility in Gujarat will deliver 210 cars for the first RRTS corridor.

280.title: CAA will be implemented the moment COVID-19 pandemic ends: Amit Shah
280.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah while addressing a public rally in West Bengal's Siliguri on Thursday said the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) will be implemented the moment COVID-19 pandemic ends. He said, "TMC is spreading rumours about CAA that it won't be implemented on the ground." Shah further said, "Mamata Didi wants infiltration...CAA was, is and will be a reality."

281.title: Big B & I used to discuss his films during 'Runway 34' shoot: Rakul
281.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh, talking about working with Amitabh Bachchan in 'Runway 34', has said, "I had a lot of discussions with him about his experience of the films that he has shot." She stated that both of them used to talk about his COVID-19 recovery, and his experience while shooting for 'Agneepath' and 'Coolie'. 'Runway 34' also featured Ajay Devgn.

282.title: Bihar at bottom of ladder in every index: Prashant Kishor
282.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor said that Bihar is at the bottom of the ladder in every index, adding that the state can't achieve the heights of development on the path it has taken so far. Over the next few months, Kishor said, he would interact with 18,000 people, both political and non-political, he met through his previous activities in Bihar.

283.title: BJP planning to demolish 2,000 unauthorised colonies in Delhi: AAP
283.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Thursday alleged that the BJP, which is ruling the three civic bodies, was planning to demolish 1,750 unauthorised and 860 slum colonies. In the last 17 years, BJP leaders in the civic bodies, councillors and mayors "amassed money" by allowing illegal construction to flourish only to serve them notices now, Sisodia alleged.

284.title: Mira Road police recover banned gutka products worth ₹15 lakh
284.article_body: A team of Mira Road police seized banned gutka products worth ₹15 lakh on Wednesday. This comes a week after the Mira Road police caught two men transporting gutka products in an auto-rickshaw. Police said they were looking for an absconding accused when they found the products. We are trying to ascertain the main source and supply chain, police added.

285.title: Mumbai man stabs woman & constable who came to help her, arrested
285.article_body: A 31-year-old man from Mumbai was arrested for allegedly stabbing a 25-year-old woman and an on-duty police constable who came to help her in Wadala. Police said that the accused and his family had contacted the woman's family with a marriage proposal, which they rejected and this angered the accused. The woman and the constable suffered deep wounds, police added.

286.title: Apologise to North Indians before entering Ayodhya: BJP MP to MNS chief
286.article_body: BJP MP Brijbhushan Sharan Singh has said he won't allow MNS chief Raj Thackeray to enter Ayodhya until he apologises to North Indians for his remarks made against them in 2008. "We have been watching since 2008, they brought to the fore the issue of 'Marathi Manush'," the MP added. Thackeray has announced his visit to Ayodhya on June 5.

287.title: Class 1 student crushed to death by bus on school premises in UP
287.article_body: A six-year-old Class 1 student died after a school bus rammed into him on the premises of Royal Convent Inter College in UP's Baghpat on Thursday, police said. The incident occurred when the bus driver was reversing the vehicle. The victim's body has been sent for post-mortem and an FIR has been registered against the school manager and the driver.

288.title: Over 600 Ukrainian fighters killed in artillery strikes: Russia
288.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry said on Thursday that over 600 Ukrainian fighters were killed after its artillery struck multiple Ukrainian positions and strongholds overnight. It added that 61 units of weapons and military equipment were also destroyed in the artillery strikes. Meanwhile, Ukraine has accused that Russia is "resorting to the missile terrorism tactics to spread fear across Ukraine".

289.title: DGCA starts night checks of airplanes following SpiceJet flight turbulence
289.article_body: DGCA has initiated surprise night checks to assess the fitness of aircrafts across several airports following recent turbulence on SpiceJet's Mumbai-Durgapur flight. DGCA has directed teams to examine cockpits, cabins and check for potential safety hazards like loose fittings of aircraft seats and windows. "If airlines are found [violating] rules, they're liable to pay heavy penalties," it said.

290.title: Kanye was upset because I called him rapper during SNL monologue: Kim
290.article_body: Kim Kardashian, during an episode of 'The Kardashians', has revealed the reason why her ex-husband Kanye West was "upset" by her Saturday Night Live (SNL) monologue. "Kanye wished I said the word 'filed' for divorce...he was upset that I also said he was a rapper. He said, 'I'm...much more than a rapper...can't believe you said rapper," Kim told Khloé Kardashian.

291.title: Meta wristband to control smart glasses, other devices: Zuckerberg
291.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg on Wednesday shared a picture of eyewear maker EssilorLuxottica's chairman using a prototype of Meta's neural interface wristband. He wrote, "[The wristband] will eventually let you control your [smart] glasses and other devices." Last year, Meta had said it planned to develop a wristband that'd allow users to interact with a virtual world using finger movements.

292.title: Why would someone play 5-day cricket and get ₹5 lakh: Yuvraj on 'dying' Test cricket
292.article_body: Former India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh has opined that Test cricket is dying, adding that people want to play and watch T20 cricket. "Why would someone play five-day cricket and get ₹5 lakh [when cricketers] today play T20 cricket and get ₹50 lakh?" He added, "Players who have not made it to international cricket are getting ₹7-10 crore."

293.title: Journalist Pawan Jaiswal, who exposed roti-salt mid-day meal in UP school, dies of cancer
293.article_body: Journalist Pawan Jaiswal, who had filmed students at a government school in Uttar Pradesh eating rotis with salt as their mid-day meal in 2019, passed away after battling oral cancer. The journalist was struggling to pay for his treatment and had appealed for funds last month. "Deeply saddened to hear about the untimely demise of this honest...journalist," tweeted Urmila Matondkar.

294.title: Govt plans to cut taxes on edible oils to curb rising prices: Report
294.article_body: The government is planning to cut taxes on some edible oils to curb the rising prices, Bloomberg reported on Thursday. Prices of edible oil have soared in the country after the war in Ukraine and Indonesia's ban on palm oil exports. India is reportedly looking to slash the agriculture infrastructure and development cess on crude palm oil imports from 5%.

295.title: Amit Shah should form panel to probe riots if he has courage: Gehlot
295.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said Home Minister Amit Shah should form a committee to probe the cause of riots in seven states "if he has the courage". Everything will become clear and riots won't happen, Gehlot added. Referring to repeated violence in Rajasthan, Gehlot said, "It's [BJP's] attempt to ignite a fire as they're losing the next [Rajasthan Assembly] election."

296.title: Cong delegation to visit UP's Lalitpur to meet rape victim's family
296.article_body: A six-member delegation of Congress will visit UP's Lalitpur to meet the family of the alleged rape victim. Earlier on Wednesday, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav met the victim's family. The 13-year-old rape survivor was allegedly raped again by the Station House Officer when she went to the police station to file a complaint against four men for gangraping her.

297.title: Chhattisgarh CM announces helicopter ride for Classes 10, 12 board toppers
297.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Thursday said the students who will top in Classes 10 and 12 board examinations will be rewarded with a helicopter ride. The rides will be offered to district-wise toppers, he added. "I believe...a helicopter ride will inculcate in the minds of children a desire to fly high in the skies of life," Baghel said.

298.title: Thane man gets 2 yrs in jail for flashing private parts at school girl
298.article_body: A special court has sentenced a 32-year-old man to two years in jail for flashing his private parts at a school girl in Thane in 2018. The accused would wait at spot en route to school and flash victim as she'd pass by. The victim later complained to her mother about act, following which accused was handed over to police.

299.title: Man dies as accused puts him in car's boot & drives for hours in B'luru
299.article_body: A 33-year-old man died from breathlessness and suffocation after an accused put him in the boot of a car and drove around Bengaluru for hours, according to reports. Later, the accused and his partners dumped his body on a pavement and fled. The accused was reportedly in a relationship with the victim's wife. Police have arrested him and his partners.

300.title: Odisha sounds cyclone alert, 18 districts asked to take measures
300.article_body: The Odisha government has issued an alert of a possible cyclone over the Bay of Bengal. Odisha Special Relief Commissioner (SRC) has also written to the collectors of 18 districts, asking them to undertake all measures to safeguard people and their properties. "The state is well prepared for the eventuality if any," Odisha chief secretary SC Mohapatra had earlier said.

301.title: Bank of England warns of recession in the UK, hikes interest rates to 1%
301.article_body: The Bank of England on Thursday raised the interest rates by 25 bps to 1%, the highest since 2009.  The move is aimed at countering the inflation that's now heading above 10%. The Bank of England also sent a warning that the UK economy risks sliding into recession later this year amid higher energy prices pushing inflation.

302.title: Vegetable vendor's daughter clears civil judge exam in MP's Indore
302.article_body: A 29-year-old daughter of a vegetable vendor in Madhya Pradesh's Indore has cleared the civil judge exam. Ankita Nagar, who cleared the exam in her fourth attempt, said she used to help her father after completing her preparations. "Despite three unsuccessful attempts, I did not give up...This struggle opened doors for me and I kept moving forward," Nagar said.

303.title: May you always live life with joy & courage: Katrina on mom's 70th b'day
303.article_body: Katrina Kaif wished her mother, Suzanne Turquotte, on her birthday. Taking to Instagram, Katrina gave a glimpse of her mother's 70th birthday which she celebrated with her family. The pictures had Suzanne posing with her birthday cake. Alongside the post, Katrina wrote, "Happy 70th mama. May you always live life with...joy and courage that you do...surrounded by your...noisy kids."

304.title: Western intelligence to Ukraine won't thwart our goals: Russia
304.article_body: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said Russia is "aware" that the US, Britain and other NATO nations are "constantly" feeding intelligence to Ukraine. This wouldn't stop Russia from achieving its military objectives in Ukraine, he added. Peskov's comments came in response to a New York Times report stating that US had provided intelligence that helped Ukrainian forces kill many Russian generals.

305.title: Concept of regional movies exists in India only: Hansika Motwani
305.article_body: Actress Hansika Motwani has said the concept of regional movies exists in India only, whereas the world views such films as "Indian movies". "After the remarkable feat of certain movies from the South, the scenario has completely changed," she added. "Today, it's nice to see that people have started accepting the movies in every region with red carpets," Hansika stated.

306.title: It took cajoling to attend Ranbir-Alia's party post accident: Malaika
306.article_body: Malaika Arora has said that she was afraid of sitting in the car for the next 15 days after her car accident which took place in April. "There is fear, worry and anxiety. It takes cajoling to get me out, anywhere," she stated. "In fact, it took some cajoling to attend Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding bash," she added.

307.title: Meta freezes hiring for 2022 after slow revenue growth: Report
307.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta has temporarily stopped hiring for the remainder of 2022 and is lowering hiring targets, Reuters reported citing Business Insider. This comes after Meta last week recorded its slowest revenue growth in a decade. "In light of the expense guidance given for this earnings period, we are slowing [talent] growth accordingly," a Meta spokesperson said in an e-mailed statement.

308.title: Delhi to give electricity subsidy to only those who ask for it from Oct 1: CM
308.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday announced that from October 1, subsidy on electricity will be provided to only those who ask for it. "Now cheap electricity will be optional in Delhi," Kejriwal said. He added that if someone considers himself capable, then he can tell the Delhi government that he doesn't want the subsidy.

309.title: Delimitation panel finalises electoral seats in J&K; increases Assembly seats to 90
309.article_body: The Delimitation Commission tasked with redrawing the assembly constituencies of Jammu and Kashmir finalised the delimitation order for the Union Territory. As per the final Delimitation Order, the Assembly constituencies have been increased to 90, of which 43 will be part of Jammu region and 47 of Kashmir region. Nine seats have been reserved for STs and seven for SCs.

310.title: Armenia detains dozens of protesters demanding PM's resignation
310.article_body: Police in Armenia on Thursday detained dozens of protesters demanding Armenian PM Nikol Pashinyan's resignation. Local television footage showed police officers grabbing and dragging protesters into vans. Pashinyan has faced backlash since he agreed to a Russian-brokered truce to end six weeks of war with Azerbaijan over the disputed region of Nagorno-Karabakh in November 2020.

311.title: I'll think twice about doing a remake if original's available on OTT: Kiara
311.article_body: Actress Kiara Advani said she will "think twice" about acting in a remake if the original film is available on an OTT platform. "I did 'Kabir Singh' before OTT became a rage," added Kiara. 'Kabir Singh' which also starred Shahid Kapoor, was a remake of the 2017 Telugu film 'Arjun Reddy'. Kiara will be next seen in 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'.

312.title: Stepping down was a mistake, Dhoni should've led from start: Sehwag
312.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has said naming Ravindra Jadeja as CSK captain in place of MS Dhoni was a mistake. "Also, I think, if Jadeja was the captain, he should've been sustained for the rest of the season," Sehwag added. "Had Dhoni been the captain from the beginning then...maybe CSK wouldn't have lost so many matches," he further said.

313.title: 3 robots handed over to Pune civic body to help clean manholes
313.article_body: Three robots will be used to clean manholes in Pune. "These robots have been handed over to the civic solid waste management department...There have been incidents...when sanitation workers working in manholes have died...The use of robots for cleaning manholes would get the PMC's choked and blocked sewage lines cleaned without putting human life at risk," an official said.

314.title: Gujarat MLA Jignesh Mevani gets 3 months in jail over 2017 'Azadi' march
314.article_body: A Gujarat court on Thursday sentenced Vadgam MLA Jignesh Mevani and nine others, including NCP's Reshma Patel, to three months in jail in a 2017 case of holding 'Azadi' march without permission. The court found them guilty of being part of unlawful assembly under IPC section 143. The march was taken out from Mahesana to Dhanera in the Banaskantha district.

315.title: Elon Musk secures over $7 billion in new financing to buy Twitter
315.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk has secured $7.139 billion in new financing commitments for the acquisition of Twitter, a company filing showed on Thursday. The investors who committed financing include the world's largest crypto exchange Binance, Oracle Co-founder Larry Ellison, Vy Capital and Sequoia Capital Fund among others. Last month, Musk struck a deal to buy Twitter for $44 billion.

316.title: Shaw's batting like he doesn't care, Pant should speak to him: Ajay Jadeja
316.article_body: Sharing his opinion on DC opener Prithvi Shaw, ex-India batter Ajay Jadeja said, "Shaw is batting as if he doesn't care." "If this is how he wants to bat, I would advice Rishabh Pant to...tell Shaw- 'If you are...going to throw the bat at every ball, I can also do that. So let me only open the innings'," added Jadeja.

317.title: BJP playing bulldozer politics, entire Delhi will collapse: Manish Sisodia
317.article_body: Amid anti-encroachment drive in Delhi, Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia accused BJP of playing bulldozer politics and said notices should be sent to councillors who allowed illegal construction. "Notices have been sent to 1,750 unauthorised...colonies where...50 lakh people live...[and] 860 colonies...where 10 lakh people live...," he said. "In this way, entire Delhi will collapse," he added.

318.title: US hospital sued over racism as black woman dies after C-section
318.article_body: A US hospital has been sued by a man whose wife, a black woman, died after childbirth in 2016. The man has claimed that his wife bled to death because of a culture of racism at the hospital. "There's no doubt in my mind that my wife would be here today...if she was a Caucasian woman," he said.

319.title: Big B shares teaser of Kangana's song from Dhaakad; deletes it later
319.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan shared the teaser of actress Kangana Ranaut's song from 'Dhaakad', however, he soon deleted it. Amitabh shared the post on Instagram and wrote, "All good wishes." He also tagged Kangana, Arjun Rampal, Divya Dutta and other members of the team. He later deleted the post. Kangana had also shared the same teaser on her social media on Wednesday.

320.title: In UP if girls go to get justice, victims are made the accused: Mamata
320.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee criticised the Uttar Pradesh government and said, "Today in UP if girls go to get justice, victims are made the accused." "I don't even leave my own (party workers) if they're guilty. But there are some who keep circulating fake videos," she added. "Bengal is better than other states," the TMC chief said.

321.title: Gujarat MLA Mevani sentenced to 3-month jail for 'Azadi' march in 2017
321.article_body: A Gujarat court has sentenced MLA Jignesh Mevani and nine others to three months in jail for taking out an 'Azadi' march on the first anniversary of the Una flogging incident without permission in 2017. NCP functionary Reshma Patel is among those convicted. Notably, Mevani was recently arrested by Assam Police over his alleged objectionable tweets about PM Narendra Modi.

322.title: When I heard Jadeja would lead CSK, I was blown away: Shane Watson
322.article_body: Talking about Ravindra Jadeja handing back CSK captaincy to MS Dhoni, former all-rounder Shane Watson said, "When I had initially heard that Ravindra Jadeja was going to take over, I was blown away!" He added, "It was always going to be difficult for Jadeja no matter what. In the end, I do feel a little bit sorry for Jadeja."

323.title: Taapsee is a rare actress who's also a good human being: Sudhir Mishra
323.article_body: Speaking about working with actress Taapsee Pannu in his film, director Sudhir Mishra said, "I'm...glad I worked with her. She's a rare actress who's also a good human being, so working with her was a breeze." "I needed a...good actress who could be seen ageing over 30 years in half an hour. Taapsee...managed the transition very smoothly," he added.

324.title: Didn't make any money from Shark Tank: Ashneer on reports of getting ₹10 lakh per episode
324.article_body: Ashneer Grover, speaking about Shark Tank India, said, "None of us made any money from the show." "Some people said...we made ₹10 lakh per episode, but I'd have been happy with even ₹5 lakh...They asked us to commit to spending ₹10 crore each...We said okay," he added. "We weren't paid anything; in fact, we worked like bonded labour," Ashneer stated.

325.title: Filled with joy: Sood on meeting girl whom he helped overcome spinal defect
325.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood recently met Janhvi, a girl whom he helped a few months ago for her surgery as she suffered from a spinal disorder since birth. Janhvi and her father went to Shirdi to meet Sood. While speaking about the same, Sood said, "It fills my heart with joy to watch the young girl stand on her own and...walk."

326.title: MI should have stuck with Tim David a lot more: Shane Watson
326.article_body: DC assistant coach Shane Watson has said he was surprised that MI played Tim David only for two games before dropping him at the start of the IPL season. "They should've stuck with a lot more, even for 4-5 games to see what he can do," added Watson. David played his third game against RR and scored a match-winning 20*(9).

327.title: RPF Bengaluru seizes illicit liquor worth over ₹20,000
327.article_body: The Railway Protection Force (RPF) of the Bengaluru division on Wednesday apprehended a person and seized illicit liquor worth approximately ₹20,235. A total of 576 tetra packs of 90 ml whiskey were found in the passenger's bags, the South Western Railway said. The liquor has been handed over to excise department officials, it added, sharing the photo of the seizure.

328.title: Pope uses wheelchair for first time in public due to knee pain
328.article_body: Pope Francis was seen using a wheelchair for the first time in public when he attended the plenary assembly of the International Union of Superiors General at the Vatican on Thursday. He is said to be suffering from knee pain, which has restricted his movement. He has lately been struggling to walk or stand.

329.title: Roads near Sri Lankan parliament blocked for public amid protests
329.article_body: Police have blocked roads near Sri Lankan parliament to the public for the days the House will be in session amid the country's ongoing economic crisis. This comes after 12 anti-government protesters were arrested near the premises for demanding the resignation of President Gotabaya Rajapaksa. People residing near parliament will have to show identity proof to commute through these roads.

330.title: BJP discussing Rahul's nightclub visit, not pressing issues: Shiv Sena
330.article_body: Shiv Sena criticised the BJP for ignoring pressing issues but targeting Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for his nightclub visit. "Instead of discussing power shortage, lack of jobs, the question of the support price for farmers, inflation, the Chinese army infiltrating the country's borders, members of BJP are still shooting arrows at Rahul Gandhi's visit to Nepal," the Shiv Sena said.

331.title: Unicorn DealShare looks to hire 1,500 people by the end of FY23
331.article_body: Grocery-focused social commerce startup DealShare, valued at $1.7 billion in January, is looking to hire up to 1,500 employees across tech and product side by the end of FY23. As per CEO Vineet Rao, DealShare has already doubled its workforce to 2,000 since last year. It's also planning to acquire 5-10 small brands with their own manufacturing units, Rao said.

332.title: SDMC's anti-encroachment drive near Shaheen Bagh cancelled till Friday
332.article_body: The anti-encroachment drives in the Kalindi Kunj-Jamia Nagar area near Shaheen Bagh and in Sriniwaspuri have been cancelled till Friday, South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) said on Thursday. "The police informed us...adequate force cannot be provided for the drive today. We will reschedule the drive accordingly," SDMC added. Earlier, a drive in Jasola and Sarita Vihar was also cancelled.

333.title: Prayagraj to get Uttar Pradesh's first floating restaurant
333.article_body: The Yogi Adityanath-led government in Uttar Pradesh is planning to build a floating restaurant in Prayagraj, which will be the first such restaurant in the state. The proposed floating restaurant, which is coming up at the Boat Club, will run on the PPP model and will offer a whole range of cuisines, a government spokesperson said.

334.title: 23-yr-old medical intern sets herself on fire at Noida park, note found
334.article_body: A 23-year-old medical intern from Delhi's Greater Kailash area set herself ablaze at a park in Noida on Wednesday, with police suspecting that she took the step due to a mental health condition. Police found a hand-written note, a two-litre empty bottle of diesel, a purse and a mobile phone on the spot. Police and forensic experts reached the area.

335.title: Hit those who don’t say Bharat Mata ki Jai with sticks: BJP’s Gyan Dev
335.article_body: BJP leader Gyan Dev Ahuja appealed to people to "hit" those who don’t say "Bharat Mata ki Jai" with sticks. "Muslims never ruled India. It was ruled by Mughals and Afghans. Hit those who don’t say Bharat Mata ki Jai with sticks," Ahuja said while speaking at BJP’s Jan Hunkar Rally in Alwar.

336.title: Hindus suffered more due to MNS' stand on loudspeakers: Cong leader
336.article_body: Maharashtra Congress spokesperson Sachin Sawant on Thursday claimed Hindus have suffered more because of MNS chief Raj Thackeray's objection over the use of loudspeakers at mosques. "If we listen to...MNS, along with masjids, 2,400 temples will also not be able to use loudspeakers," he tweeted. MNS' agitation will have repercussions across all religious communities, Sawant added.

337.title: 3 men strip minor boys for gambling, beat them & film act in Hyd
337.article_body: Three men, who allegedly assaulted a group of minor boys after making them strip in Hyderabad's Old City, were arrested after a video of the incident surfaced online. According to the police, the men found the group of boys gambling. To teach them a lesson, the accused hit them with a stick and recorded the act, police added.

338.title: We have ignored Northeast India, it is very disheartening: Ayushmann
338.article_body: Talking about his upcoming film 'Anek' which is based in Northeast India, Ayushmann Khurrana said, "We have...ignored Northeast India...and the kind of racism they face in the mainland...it's very disheartening." "People from the mainland will realise where they are going wrong," added Ayushmann. "It's a very...different film which Indian cinema hasn't witnessed in the past," stated Ayushmann.

339.title: Pant takes all the pressure, responsibility on himself: Chetan Sakariya
339.article_body: Speaking about his tenure with DC, pacer Chetan Sakariya praised coach Ricky Ponting and skipper Rishabh Pant for keeping him motivated. He added, "Pant takes all the pressure, responsibility on himself...[and] whenever the other players do well, he gives them credit." Sakariya has picked one wicket in the two games he has played so far in IPL 2022.

340.title: Russia stole 4,00,000 tonnes of grain: Ukraine
340.article_body: Russia has stolen 4,00,000 tonnes of grain from occupied regions in southern Ukraine, Ukrainian Defence Ministry said. "Russian thieves are bringing death and famine to the world," it added. As per International Grains Council data, Ukraine sold 44.7 million tonnes of grain abroad in 2020-21, making it the world's fourth-largest supplier. The volume of exports has fallen sharply amid war.

341.title: Delhivery shares fall in unlisted market ahead of its IPO: Report
341.article_body: Logistics startup Delhivery's shares fell nearly 40% in the unlisted market from the peak of ₹950/share in January ahead of its upcoming IPO, Moneycontrol reported. The unlisted shares are reportedly quoting at ₹550-600/share on thin trading volume. Delhivery's price band, at ₹462-487/share, is about 19% lower than the current unlisted share price. It aims to raise ₹5,235 crore.

342.title: Boy who ranked 45th in K'taka Police exam paid agent ₹50 lakh: CID
342.article_body: The Karnataka CID team revealed that father of a BSc graduate who secured 45th rank in police sub-inspector recruitment exam had paid ₹50 lakh to an agent to secure higher rank. "The family members of many candidates were actively involved in financing the cheating," a police official said. The recruitment process has now been declared cancelled by the Karnataka government.

343.title: RBI hike to increase SBI's lending rate by 0.02%: SBI Chairman
343.article_body: SBI Chairman Dinesh Kumar Khara has said that the 40 bps hike in repo rate to 4.40% will increase SBI's marginal cost of funds-based lending rate (MCLR) by two basis points. He further said that the removal of excess liquidity from the market will "improve the pricing of loans". As per RBI's announcement, liquidity worth ₹87,000 crore could be withdrawn.

344.title: Apple stops accepting debit & credit cards for app purchases, subscriptions in India
344.article_body: Apple has stopped accepting debit and credit cards to buy apps from the App Store, use Apple subscriptions like iCloud+ and Apple Music in India. Apple's support page states that the company currently only supports net-banking, UPI and Apple ID balance as payment options. This comes after new auto-debit rules from RBI came into force last year.

345.title: I wish to see a Brahmin as the CM of Maharashtra: Union Minister
345.article_body: Union Minister Raosaheb Patil Danve has said, "I just don't want to see Brahmins as corporators or civic body heads, I wish to see a Brahmin as the CM of [Maharashtra]." He added that so much casteism has come into politics that it cannot be ignored. "There should be a leader who can keep communities together," Patil said.

346.title: 4 terror suspects with Pak link caught with huge cache of explosives in Haryana
346.article_body: Four terror suspects were caught with a huge cache of explosives in Haryana's Karnal city on Thursday. Karnal SP Ganga Ram Punia informed that the accused were in touch with a Pakistan-based man who asked them to drop arms and ammunition in Adilabad, Telangana. The four accused were identified as Gurpreet, Amandeep, Parminder, and Bhupinder, hailing from Ferozepur and Ludhiana.

347.title: Many eco-friendly children’s clothing contain toxic PFAS: Study
347.article_body: Many children's products like clothes, bedding and furniture, including those with green certifications, contain harmful PFAS chemicals, also known as forever chemicals, a study has found. The products labelled as water or stain-resistant are most likely to contain PFAS that aren't listed on label.
