PFAS are linked with health conditions like cancer, thyroid disease, high cholesterol, asthma, etc.

348.title: Hyd woman's brother arrested for killing her husband over inter-faith marriage
348.article_body: After a 25-year-old man was killed by his wife's family over their inter-faith marriage in Hyderabad, police have arrested her brother in connection with the incident. The couple was returning home on a motorcycle when they were waylaid and attacked with a crowbar. The man died on the spot while the woman was injured.

349.title: WhatsApp starts rolling out emoji reactions for messages
349.article_body: Meta-owned WhatsApp has started rolling out emoji reactions for messages, Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced. Zuckerberg said WhatsApp is also adding the folded hands emoji "to help spread thanks and appreciation". "Emoji reactions are coming to WhatsApp so people can quickly share their opinion without flooding chats with new messages," WhatsApp had said in April.

350.title: Which batters have faced the most balls in IPL history?
350.article_body: RCB's Virat Kohli on Wednesday became the first batter to face at least 5,000 deliveries in IPL history. Kohli has faced 5,028 balls in IPL. He is followed by PBKS opener Shikhar Dhawan, who has faced 4,863 deliveries in IPL. MI captain Rohit Sharma has faced 4,429 deliveries, while DC opener David Warner has faced 4,062 deliveries.

351.title: I went into a dark place last summer and feared I'd never play cricket again: Archer
351.article_body: Talking about recovering from his injury, England pacer Jofra Archer, who last played a professional match in July 2021, said that he went into a dark place last summer and feared he'd never play cricket again. Archer, who is expecting to make a comeback this month, added, "Suppose...I had rushed my comeback...I might have messed things up more."

352.title: Woman secretly pokes holes in man's condoms in Germany, found guilty of sexual assault
352.article_body: A German court found a woman guilty of sexual assault and handed her a six-month suspended sentence for purposefully damaging her partner's condoms by poking holes in them, German media reported. "We've written legal history," the judge reportedly told the court. "The condoms were rendered unusable without the man's knowledge or...consent. No means no here as well," the judge said.

353.title: Was stuck in make-up van for 3 days with network issues: Anees on Mumbai floods
353.article_body: Filmmaker Anees Bazmee said that he was stuck in his make-up van during 2005 Mumbai floods. "I got stuck in bumper-to-bumper traffic. I took U-Turn and came back to shooting spot, and took refuge in make-up van. There were network issues too...I was stuck in the van for three days. We faced difficulty in getting food and water," he added.

354.title: Rohit is disappointed for not being able to convert his starts: Jayawardena
354.article_body: Talking about captain Rohit Sharma's form in IPL 2022, MI head coach Mahela Jayawardena said, "He is disappointed that he has not been able to convert his starts but it’s about executing our game plans." So far, Rohit has scored 155 runs in nine games at an average of 17.22. He's yet to cross the 50-run mark in the tournament.

355.title: Delhi man grows plants on roof of his auto to beat heat, pics surface
355.article_body: Amid the ongoing heatwave conditions across the country, an auto-rickshaw driver in Delhi planted a variety of plants on the roof of his auto-rickshaw to beat the heat. The driver, Mahendra Kumar, said that there are 25 varieties of plants that are planted on the auto-rickshaw's roof. Kumar added, "Auto-rickshaw used to simmer during summers, but now it remains cool."

356.title: Pune ZP to procure essential items needed in 109 primary health centres
356.article_body: Pune Zilla Parishad (ZP) will procure essential items needed in its 109 primary health centres by May-end, an official confirmed. A gap in items worth ₹21 crore was identified of which ₹17 crore was raised through corporate social responsibility and remaining funds will be given by administration. There'll be improvement in services provided at these centres, Pune ZP CEO said.

357.title: 'I just can't bat with you, you run too fast', Maxwell jokingly tells Kohli after run-out
357.article_body: After being run-out for 3(3) while batting with Virat Kohli against CSK, RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell jokingly told Kohli, "I just can't bat with you." He added, "You run too fast. You hit ones and twos. I don't." Maxwell was run-out after Kohli called for a quick single on the last delivery of the ninth over.

358.title: Rainfall predicted in several states/UTs; IMD releases list
358.article_body: IMD has predicted moderate to light rainfall in Arunachal Pradesh, Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, Tripura, Bihar, Jharkhand, West Bengal, Sikkim, Odisha, Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, Karnataka, Andhra Pradesh and Telangana during next five days. Light rainfall is likely over J&K, Ladakh, Himachal Pradesh and Uttarakhand during next three days and in Punjab, Haryana and UP today.

359.title: Sketch of man who took off 2 girls' clothes at Delhi school released
359.article_body: A sketch of the man who allegedly entered a municipal school in Delhi and sexually assaulted two girls has been released by the police. According to Delhi Commission for Women chief Swati Maliwal, the man took off the girls' clothes and urinated in front of an entire class. Police said that continuous efforts are on to arrest the accused.

360.title: Committee should be formed to probe riot incidents: Gehlot
360.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot said that if Union Home Minister Amit Shah has "courage" then a committee should be formed to probe recent riots across various states. "People showered flowers on Ram Navami processions. Riots happened in seven states and bulldozers were used," Gehlot added. "A similar method like that of Karauli was used in all seven states," Gehlot stated.

361.title: QR code-enabled billboards to be put up in B'luru for anti-tobacco campaign
361.article_body: Karnataka Health Minister Dr K Sudhakar has launched a campaign, '#IndiaVsTobacco', to work towards a tobacco-free country. He also unveiled QR code-enabled billboards and posters, which will be put up across Bengaluru for interactive engagement regarding tobacco related health impacts. The billboards reportedly contain a fact about secondhand smoke that people can view by scanning the QR codes.

362.title: 211 arrested after clashes in Jodhpur on Eid: Rajasthan DGP
362.article_body: As many as 211 people have been arrested in connection with clashes that broke out in Jodhpur on Eid, Rajasthan DGP ML Lather said. A curfew, which was imposed in several areas of Jodhpur following the clashes, continued for the third day on Thursday. Four FIRs have been registered by the police and 15 have been registered based on complaints.

363.title: 45 teachers involved in Andhra SSC paper leak: Education Minister
363.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Education Minister Botcha Satyanarayana on Thursday said that 45 teachers were involved in the alleged leak of question papers from the ongoing SSC exams for Class 10 students.  The government has taken action against 69 people, he added. The teachers have been accused of taking photos of the question papers after exams commenced and leaking them online.

364.title: I am not happy with my performance, haven't lived up to expectations: Siraj
364.article_body: RCB pacer Mohammed Siraj said he is "not happy" with his performance in IPL 2022 so far, adding that he has not lived up to the expectations of the fans. "Believe in me, I will make a comeback," stated Siraj. Siraj has picked eight wickets in IPL 2022 so far at an economy rate of 9.47.

365.title: 22 killed, 40 injured as heavy rains trigger floods in Afghanistan
365.article_body: At least 22 people have been killed and around 40 others have been injured after heavy rains in Afghanistan triggered floods, a disaster management official said on Thursday. Hundreds of houses and some 3,000 acres of crops have also been damaged due to the rains. As per the officials, the Taliban government will approach international relief organisations for help.

366.title: I'm excited: Shivangi Joshi on being a part of Khatron Ke Khiladi 12
366.article_body: Actress Shivangi Joshi said that she will be a part of the show 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12'. She added, "'Khatron Ke Khiladi' is going to be my first ever reality show and I am extremely excited...The show will be a good platform to overcome my fears and test my abilities." "I'm looking forward to meeting Rohit Shetty sir," she said.

367.title: US Prez Biden declares disaster in wildfire-hit New Mexico
367.article_body: US President Joe Biden has approved a disaster declaration for several parts of New Mexico that have been hit by massive wildfires. According to experts, the wildfires are more widespread than usual owing to climate change. Several counties of the state, including Mora, San Miguel, Colfax and Valencia, will receive federal funding for rehabilitation after hundreds of houses were burnt.

368.title: 7 people booked for uploading child pornography in Pimpri Chinchwad
368.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Police on Wednesday registered two separate cases against seven individuals who uploaded child pornography content. According to police, the content had been posted last year on various social media websites. Additionally, police have initiated a probe into the cell phone numbers, email addresses and social media accounts used by the accused to upload the content.

369.title: Have assurance, US won't allow Russia to act against us: Sweden
369.article_body: Sweden has said if Russia directs any activities against it, the US will not allow it. The statement comes after Swedish Foreign Minister Ann Linde met US Secretary of State Antony Blinken. Linde said Sweden will receive support while its potential application for NATO membership is processed. "I feel very sure that now we have an American assurance," she said.

370.title: DMK MPs to contribute one month's salary towards Sri Lanka aid
370.article_body: The Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) on Thursday announced that the party's Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha MP's will be donating their one month's salary towards aid for the crisis-hit Sri Lanka. This comes after Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin appealed to the people to donate to the state government to buy essentials like food and ship them to Sri Lanka.

371.title: Pic shows tunnel used by Pak terrorists in J&K; BSF says Amarnath Yatra attack plan foiled
371.article_body: The BSF on Thursday said that it has detected a freshly dug cross-border tunnel that originated from Pakistan along the International Border in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba district. "With the detection of this tunnel, BSF-Jammu has foiled the nefarious designs of Pakistan-based terrorists to disrupt the upcoming Amarnath Yatra," BSF DIG said.

372.title: A run-a-ball 40 doesn't suit Pant, won't take DC anywhere: Sehwag
372.article_body: Sharing his opinion on DC captain Rishabh Pant, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said, "He must not carry any baggage and play like the [old Pant]. A run-a-ball 40 doesn't suit Pant and [won't]...take DC anywhere." "When Pant plays with responsibility, the strike rate falls," added Sehwag. Pant has scored 234 runs in nine IPL 2022 matches so far.

373.title: Nobody should speak language of ultimatum: Ajit Pawar to Raj Thackeray
373.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar criticised Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray's "ultimatum to Maharashtra government" remark and said that nobody should speak the "language of ultimatum". "This is not a dictatorship. If you want to give an ultimatum sitting inside your home to your family members, do it, we have nothing to do with it," he added.

374.title: HC grants bail to Pune man booked for raping 17-yr-old niece in 2019
374.article_body: A man from Pune who was booked for raping his minor niece in 2019 has been given bail by the Bombay High Court. The court said the 17-year-old girl was a college-going girl with sufficient understanding. As per a complaint, the man met the girl in college and forcibly took her to a hotel where he sexually assaulted her.

375.title: Didn't feel like a normal scene: Amber on kissing Depp during Rum Diary shoot
375.article_body: Amber Heard recalled her kiss with Johnny Depp while shooting for 'Rum Diary' while testifying during the defamation trial. Amber said the shower scene "didn't feel like a normal scene. It felt real." Recalling an incident in Depp's trailer, she said, "He...picked up...back of my robe with his boot...I...turned around and giggled...He...playfully pushed me down on...bed, sofa...he said, 'Yum'."

376.title: Facebook became Frankenstein monster, devoured user data: WhatsApp's ex-CBO
376.article_body: WhatsApp's former Chief Business Officer (CBO) Neeraj Arora, who regrets WhatsApp's $22 billion sale to Facebook in 2014, tweeted, "Nobody knew in the beginning that Facebook would become a Frankenstein monster that devoured user data and spat out dirty money." He added, "We didn’t either." Arora also said, "Tech companies need to admit when they have done wrong."

377.title: Police stations have become 'centre of chaos' under BJP rule: Akhilesh
377.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav criticised the BJP-led UP government and held it responsible for the Lalitpur rape case incident and said that police stations have become the "centre of chaos". "The walls of Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath's house are unable to hear the problems of people," he added. Lalitpur SHO is accused of sexually assaulting a 13-year-old rape survivor.

378.title: 2 men die as bulldozer tyre bursts while filling air in Chhattisgarh, video surfaces
378.article_body: Two people were killed when a bulldozer tyre exploded while they were filling air in it at a vehicle workshop in Chhattisgarh. Footage shows a worker filling air in the tyre. Another man then comes and presses the tyre in order to check the air pressure, which leads to the explosion. The incident took place in Raipur's Siltara industrial area.

379.title: WhatsApp's ex-CBO shares Co-founder's old handwritten 'No Ads! No Games!' note
379.article_body: WhatsApp's former CBO Neeraj Arora, who said that he regrets WhatsApp's $22 billion sale to Facebook in 2014, shared a handwritten note by WhatsApp Co-founder Brian Acton, that read, "No Ads! No Games! No Gimmicks!" WhatsApp's other Co-founder Jan Koum used to keep the note taped to his desk. WhatsApp Co-founders quit Facebook a few years after WhatsApp's acquisition.

380.title: Always being told I was fat hurt me, my dad made me feel ugly: Britney Spears
380.article_body: Singer Britney Spears said that one of the things that hurt her the most in her childhood was always being told that she was fat and not good enough. "My dad always made me feel like I had to try...He ruined the deep seed of my existence...my confidence...my swag...He made me feel ugly...therefore I was," she added.

381.title: Today’s India is like plane flying in reverse, it’s headed for crash: Arundhati Roy
381.article_body: Author Arundhati Roy on Wednesday compared "today’s India" to a plane moving in reverse which is "headed for a crash". "The leaders of this country are flying the plane in reverse, everything is falling, and we are headed for a crash," Roy added. She was speaking at the launch of the book "Why do you fear my way so much?"

382.title: Oh my God: PM Modi to Indian journalists not allowed to cover event in Berlin
382.article_body: A video of PM Narendra Modi exclaiming 'Oh my God!' to Indian journalists in Germany has gone viral on social media. The incident took place when the journalists complained to PM Modi that they were not allowed to cover an event in Berlin. Reacting to it, PM Modi said, "Oh my God!" and added that he will inquire about it.

383.title: There hasn't been a better spell in his IPL career: Irfan on Maxwell’s 2/22 vs CSK
383.article_body: Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan praised RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell for registering figures of 2/22 against CSK, stating that there hasn't been a better spell in the 33-year-old's IPL career. "He bowled with his brain...the turning point...came through him...Maxwell dismissed the two batters who play spin the best," Irfan added. Maxwell dismissed Robin Uthappa and Ambati Rayudu.

384.title: Couldn't have added anything to Congress: Prashant on declining offer
384.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor said that he "couldn't have added anything to Congress". "There were thorough discussions on the ways required for the betterment of the party...I am grateful that they listened to me. But I felt I won't be able to add anything to the party. Hence, I declined the offer," he added.

385.title: Father of boy who sang for PM Modi in Germany responds after Kamra posts edited video
385.article_body: After comedian Kunal Kamra posted an edited video of the boy who sang a patriotic song for PM Narendra Modi in Germany, his father tweeted, "Though he is still very young but certainly he loves his country more than you Mr Kamra or Kachra whatever you are." "Try to work on your poor jokes," he wrote.

386.title: Will always be there rooting for you: Ajay as Akshay completes 30 yrs in B'wood
386.article_body: As actor Akshay Kumar completed 30 years in the Bollywood industry, his close friend, actor Ajay Devgn, shared a note on his social media handle and wished him a successful journey ahead. He wrote, "Congratulations Akki. 30 years in cinema and several more decades to come. Hope you set new records. Will always be there rooting & cheering for you."

387.title: 1,500 mosques, 1,300 temples allowed to use loudspeakers in Maha: Police
387.article_body: Approximately 1,500 mosques and 1,300 temples in Maharashtra, excluding Mumbai have been given permission to use loudspeakers amid the ongoing issue on the use of loudspeakers in religious places, police said on Wednesday. "Preventative action taken against more than 2,300 people. Notice...given to around 7,000 persons on 3rd-4th May," Maharashtra Police added.

388.title: 5 killed, 4 injured after auto-rickshaw collides with truck in MP
388.article_body: Five people died and four others were injured after an auto-rickshaw collided head-on with a mini truck in Madhya Pradesh's Raisen district on Thursday. The accident took place around 3 am near Tedia bridge when the auto-rickshaw was heading towards Bhopal. Four occupants of the auto-rickshaw and a minor girl travelling in the truck were killed, an official said.

389.title: I regret WhatsApp's $22 bn sale to Facebook: WhatsApp's ex-CBO Arora
389.article_body: WhatsApp's former Chief Business Officer (CBO) Neeraj Arora tweeted, "I helped negotiate the $22 billion sale to Facebook (in 2014). Today, I regret it." He said, "Our stance was very clear: No mining user data, No ads (ever), No cross-platform tracking...Of course, that's not what happened." He added, "Today...WhatsApp is a shadow of the product we poured our hearts into."

390.title: Wish my life was as interesting as it sounded: Kriti on link-up rumours
390.article_body: When asked what she thinks about the link-up rumours with her co-stars, actress Kriti Sanon said, "These petty things...don't bother me at all." "It just makes you feel like 'I wish my life was as interesting as it sounded it to be'," she added. Kriti further said that she knows all of this is a part of being a celebrity.

391.title: 40-year-old Noida woman threatens to jump from balcony, police rescue her
391.article_body: Noida Police rescued and brought back to safety a 40-year-old woman, who was allegedly standing on her balcony and was threatening to jump. Officials said that the Noida Police reached the woman's house, talked to her and brought her inside the house from the balcony. Police said that the woman was going through a depressive phase due to marital dispute.

392.title: 3 held, 37 detained after stone-pelting reported in Delhi's Welcome area
392.article_body: Delhi Police arrested three people and detained 37 others after a stone-pelting incident was reported in the national capital's Welcome area on Wednesday night. According to the police, first, the quarrel took place between the children from both the groups, then it spread to the people of the two communities resulting in stone-pelting. Further investigation is underway, police said.

393.title: 22-yr-old man makes hoax calls about blowing up Unnao railway station, held
393.article_body: A 22-year-old man was arrested for making two hoax calls and threatening to blow up the Ganga Ghat railway station in Uttar Pradesh's Unnao. "We formed a team, traced the calls and arrested the youth within 24 hours," a police official said. The accused made both the calls on May 2.

394.title: Chennai man who died in police custody had 13 wounds: Post-mortem report
394.article_body: Post-mortem report of the 25-year-old man, Vignesh, who had died in police custody in Chennai last month, has revealed that he had 13 different wounds, including 12 contusions and one abrasion. Earlier, a CCTV footage showing policemen running after him and beating him had surfaced online. He had been arrested on April 18 over alleged possession of marijuana.

395.title: I feel like what the guys in 'Lagaan' movie felt: RCB's Harshal Patel on win vs CSK
395.article_body: Referring to their 13-run win against CSK, RCB bowling all-rounder Harshal Patel said, "Very satisfying. I feel like what the guys in 'Lagaan' movie felt after they won the match and it started raining." He added, "It was a drought for the team and myself as well. Really happy that we're over that now." Harshal took three wickets against CSK.

396.title: Warning issued for fresh spell of heatwave over 6 states/UTs; list released
396.article_body: The IMD has said that a fresh spell of heatwave conditions is likely to commence over northwest India from May 7 and over central India from May 8. Heatwave conditions are likely over north Madhya Maharashtra on May 5, over Rajasthan between May 7-9, over south Haryana, Delhi, southwest Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh and Vidarbha on May 8 and 9.

397.title: Woman found alive almost 6 days after China building collapse
397.article_body: A woman was pulled alive from the rubble of a building that partially collapsed on April 29 in China's Changsha, state media reported on Thursday. Officials said at least five people have died as a result of the collapse. Authorities have arrested nine people, including the owner of the building, on suspicion of ignoring building codes or committing other violations.

398.title: Rahul, Priyanka should visit Raj & witness violent incidents: BJP leader
398.article_body: BJP state in-charge Arun Singh has asked Congress leader Rahul Gandhi to return from Nepal at the soonest and visit Rajasthan following Jodhpur violence. "He (Rahul) and Priyanka Gandhi should visit the state and witness the violent incidents," Singh added. "He should instruct the state government to maintain law and order and not indulge in appeasement politics," Singh stated.

399.title: 2 open fire in Bhajanpura, Delhi Police personnel's husband injured
399.article_body: Delhi Police has said that the preliminary investigation into the Bhajanpura firing on Wednesday revealed that two people opened fire upon another duo over personal enmity. Two people, including a Delhi Police personnel's husband, were injured in the firing. The prime suspect was having personal enmity with one of the victims on the issue of a love affair, police added.

400.title: Tomato prices soar in Bengaluru amid supply shortage
400.article_body: The rates of vegetables in Bengaluru have increased due to rise in temperature and the price of tomatoes has almost reached ₹50-65/kilogram. "The production of tomatoes in neighbouring Maharashtra has dropped over last few weeks and hence, the supply has been hit," an official said. The prices of beans and cauliflowers have also increased due to a shortage in supply.
